overview: Sarah Jordan, an American living in London in 1984, is married to the son of a wealthy British industrialist. She encounters Nick Callahan, a renegade doctor, whose impassioned plea for help to support his relief efforts in war-torn Africa moves her deeply. As a result, Sarah embarks upon a journey of discovery that leads to danger, heartbreak and romance in the far corners of the world.

crew: Chris Columbus, Rosario Dawson, Sarah Silverman, Jesse L. Martin, Taye Diggs, Anthony Rapp, Idina Menzel, Anthony Molinari, Daryl Edwards, Tracie Thoms, Aaron Lohr
overview: This rock opera tells the story of one year in the life of a group of bohemians struggling in late 1980s East Village, New York, USA. The film centers around Mark and Roger, two roommates. While a  tragedy has made Roger numb to new experiences, Mark begins capturing their world through his attempts to make a personal movie. In the year that follows, they and their friends deal with love, loss, and working together.

crew: Jay Roach, Tom Cruise, John Travolta, Steven Spielberg, Seth Green, Rob Lowe, Michael Caine, Tommy Lister Jr., Clint Howard, Gwyneth Paltrow, Fred Savage
overview: The world's most shagadelic spy continues his fight against Dr. Evil. This time, the diabolical doctor and his clone, Mini-Me, team up with a new foe—'70s kingpin Goldmember. While pursuing the team of villains to stop them from world domination, Austin gets help from his dad and an old girlfriend.

crew: Chris Koch, Jason Lee, James Brolin, Julia Stiles, Noel Fisher, Selma Blair, Lochlyn Munro, Thomas Lennon, David Koechner, Shawn Hatosy, Larry Miller
overview: Paul Morse is a good guy. When his friends throw him a wild bachelor party, he just wants to keep his conscience clean -- which is why he's shocked when he wakes up in bed with a beautiful girl named Becky and can't remember the night before. Desperate to keep his fiancée, Karen, from finding out what may or may not be the truth, he tells her a teensy lie. Soon his lies are spiraling out of control and his life is a series of comical misunderstandings.

originalTitle: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
crew: Chris Columbus, Emma Watson, Daniel Radcliffe, Fiona Shaw, Shirley Henderson, Kenneth Branagh, John Cleese, Julie Walters, Alan Rickman, Christian Coulson, Toby Jones
overview: Cars fly, trees fight back, and a mysterious house-elf comes to warn Harry Potter at the start of his second year at Hogwarts. Adventure and danger await when bloody writing on a wall announces: The Chamber Of Secrets Has Been Opened. To save Hogwarts will require all of Harry, Ron and Hermione’s magical abilities and courage.

crew: Rob Cohen, Vin Diesel, Samuel L. Jackson, Asia Argento, Danny Trejo, Marton Csokas, Till Lindemann, Tony Hawk, Thomas Ian Griffith, Leila Arcieri, Petr Jákl
overview: Xander Cage is your standard adrenaline junkie with no fear and a lousy attitude. When the US Government "recruits" him to go on a mission, he's not exactly thrilled. His mission: to gather information on an organization that may just be planning the destruction of the world, led by the nihilistic Yorgi.

crew: Takashi Miike, Tadanobu Asano, Nao Omori, Kiyohiko Shibukawa, Suzuki Matsuo, Toru Tezuka, Sakichi Sato, Yuki Kazamatsuri, Shinya Tsukamoto, Susumu Terajima, Paulyn Sun
overview: As sadomasochistic yakuza enforcer Kakihara searches for his missing boss he comes across Ichi, a repressed and psychotic killer who may be able to inflict levels of pain that Kakihara has only dreamed of.

crew: David Twohy, Vin Diesel, Karl Urban, Thandiwe Newton, Alexa Davalos, Keith David, Christina Cox, Judi Dench, Linus Roache, Nick Chinlund, Christopher Heyerdahl
overview: After years of outrunning ruthless bounty hunters, escaped convict Riddick suddenly finds himself caught between opposing forces in a fight for the future of the human race. Now, waging incredible battles on fantastic and deadly worlds, this lone, reluctant hero will emerge as humanity's champion - and the last hope for a universe on the edge of annihilation.

crew: Ram Gopal Varma, Ajay Devgan, Mohanlal, Rajpal Yadav, Urmila Matondkar, Antara Mali, Isha Koppikar, Vivek Oberoi, Manisha Koirala, Akash Khurana, Vijay Raaz
overview: Mallik is a henchman of Aslam Bhai, a Mumbai underworld kingpin. He inducts local hothead Chandu into the gang, and the two of them soon form a formidable faction within the gang, eventually displacing Aslam. As the empire grows, however, the two of them start drifting apart.

crew: Rick Famuyiwa, Nicole Ari Parker, Sanaa Lathan, Queen Latifah, Liza Lapira, Sterling K. Brown, Marc John Jefferies, Yasiin Bey, Boris Kodjoe, Common, Chyna
overview: Sidney and Dre can attribute their lifelong friendship and the launch of their careers to one single childhood instant... witnessing the birth of hip-hop on a New York street corner. Now some 15 years later, she is a revered music critic at a national magazine and he is a successful, though unfulfilled, hip-hop record company executive. Both come to realize that their true life passions will only be fulfilled by remembering what they learned that day on the corner.

crew: Betty Thomas, Famke Janssen, Eddie Murphy, Owen Wilson, Malcolm McDowell, Yan-Kay Crystal Lowe, Gary Cole, Dana Lee, Lynda Boyd, Tate Taylor, Phill Lewis
overview: When the Switchblade, the most sophisticated prototype stealth fighter created yet, is stolen from the U.S. government, one of the United States' top spies, Alex Scott, is called to action. What he doesn't expect is to get teamed up with a cocky civilian, World Class Boxing Champion Kelly Robinson, on a dangerous top secret espionage mission. Their assignment: using equal parts skill and humor, catch Arnold Gundars, one of the world's most successful arms dealers.

crew: Renny Harlin, Jonny Lee Miller, Val Kilmer, Christian Slater, Clifton Collins Jr., Eion Bailey, Kathryn Morris, Patricia Velásquez, Will Kemp, Antonie Kamerling, LL Cool J
overview: Trainees in the FBI's psychological profiling program must put their training into practice when they discover a killer in their midst.  Based very loosely on Agatha Christie's And Then There Were None.

crew: Shunji Iwai, Yu Aoi, Issey Takahashi, Takao Osawa, Ayumi Ito, Hayato Ichihara, Shugo Oshinari, Miwako Ichikawa, Yoji Tanaka, Shinji Higuchi, Izumi Inamori
overview: Charts the troubled teenage years of students Yūichi Hasumi and Shūsuke Hoshino, exploring the shifting and complex power dynamics of their relationship against the backdrop of Yūichi's love for the dreamy and abstract music of fictional pop star Lily Chou-Chou.

crew: Todd Haynes, Dennis Quaid, Julianne Moore, Dennis Haysbert, June Squibb, Patricia Clarkson, Viola Davis, Michael Gaston, Celia Weston, James Rebhorn, Chance Kelly
overview: In 1950s Connecticut, a housewife's life is upended by a marital crisis and mounting racial tensions in society.

crew: Gore Verbinski, Naomi Watts, Martin Henderson, Brian Cox, Pauley Perrette, Amber Tamblyn, Adam Brody, Sara Rue, Daveigh Chase, Sasha Barrese, Joe Chrest
overview: Rachel Keller is a journalist investigating a videotape that may have killed four teenagers. There is an urban legend about this tape: the viewer will die seven days after watching it. Rachel tracks down the video... and watches it. Now she has just seven days to unravel the mystery of the Ring so she can save herself and her son.

crew: Conrad Vernon, Kelly Asbury, Andrew Adamson, Eddie Murphy, Antonio Banderas, Cameron Diaz, Julie Andrews, John Cleese, Mike Myers, Rupert Everett, Jennifer Saunders, Andrew Adamson, Joan Rivers
overview: Shrek, Fiona, and Donkey set off to Far, Far Away to meet Fiona's mother and father, the Queen and King. But not everyone is happily ever after. Shrek and the King find it difficult to get along, and there's tension in the marriage. The Fairy Godmother discovers that Fiona has married Shrek instead of her son Prince Charming and plots to destroy their marriage.

crew: Curtis Hanson, Brittany Murphy, Michael Shannon, Anthony Mackie, Kim Basinger, Taryn Manning, Paul Bates, Brandon T. Jackson, Eminem, Evan Jones, Omar Benson Miller
overview: For Jimmy Smith, Jr., life is a daily fight just to keep hope alive. Feeding his dreams in Detroit's vibrant music scene, Jimmy wages an extraordinary personal struggle to find his own voice - and earn a place in a world where rhymes rule, legends are born and every moment… is another chance.

crew: Niki Caro, Rachel House, Cliff Curtis, Keisha Castle-Hughes, Taungaroa Emile, Vicky Haughton, Rawiri Paratene, Tahei Simpson, John Sumner, Grant Roa, Tammy Davis
overview: On the east coast of New Zealand, the Whangara people believe their presence there dates back a thousand years or more to a single ancestor, Paikea, who escaped death when his canoe capsized by riding to shore on the back of a whale. From then on, Whangara chiefs, always the first-born, always male, have been considered Paikea's direct descendants. Pai, an 11-year-old girl in a patriarchal New Zealand tribe, believes she is destined to be the new chief. But her grandfather Koro is bound by tradition to pick a male leader. Pai loves Koro more than anyone in the world, but she must fight him and a thousand years of tradition to fulfill her destiny.

crew: Lisa Cholodenko, Kate Beckinsale, Natascha McElhone, Christian Bale, Frances McDormand, Rick Gonzalez, Melissa De Sousa, Alessandro Nivola, Lauri Johnson, Patricia Place, Philip Pavel
overview: When an uptight young man and his fiancée move into his libertine mother's house, the resulting clash of life attitudes shakes everyone up.

crew: Paul Schrader, Willem Dafoe, Ed Begley Jr., Maria Bello, Joseph D. Reitman, Greg Kinnear, Michael McKean, John Kapelos, Rita Wilson, Alex Meneses, Kurt Fuller
overview: A successful TV star during the 1960s, former "Hogan's Heroes" actor Bob Crane projects a wholesome family-man image, but this front masks his persona as a sex addict who records and photographs his many encounters with women, often with the help of his seedy friend, John Henry Carpenter. This biographical drama reveals how Crane's double life takes its toll on him and his family, and ultimately contributes to his death.

crew: Jon Amiel, Stanley Tucci, Richard Jenkins, DJ Qualls, Aaron Eckhart, Bruce Greenwood, Hilary Swank, Glenn Morshower, Tchéky Karyo, Christopher Shyer, Alfre Woodard
overview: Geophysicist Dr. Josh Keyes discovers that an unknown force has caused the earth's inner core to stop rotating. With the planet's magnetic field rapidly deteriorating, our atmosphere literally starts to come apart at the seams with catastrophic consequences. To resolve the crisis, Keyes, along with a team of the world's most gifted scientists, travel into the earth's core. Their mission: detonate a device that will reactivate the core.

crew: Jim Sheridan, Djimon Hounsou, Samantha Morton, Paddy Considine, Sarah Bolger, Juan Carlos Hernández, Neal Jones, Adrian Martinez, Tom Murphy, Frank Wood, Emma Bolger
overview: A family of Irish immigrants adjusts to life on the mean streets of Hell's Kitchen while also grieving the death of a child.

crew: Dylan Kidd, Morena Baccarin, Jesse Eisenberg, Jennifer Beals, Isabella Rossellini, Lisa Emery, Campbell Scott, Ato Essandoh, Ben Shenkman, Elizabeth Berkley, Peter Appel
overview: A smooth-talking ad executive attributes his remarkable success with women to his ability to manipulate their emotions from the moment he first meets them. When his teenage nephew drops in for a visit, he soon learns that his approach isn't as foolproof as he thought when he attempts to teach the boy how to pick up women.

crew: David Gordon Green, Zooey Deschanel, Shea Whigham, Danny McBride, Patricia Clarkson, Heather McComb, Maurice Compte, Paul Schneider, Benjamin Mouton, Traci Dinwiddie, Eddie Rouse
overview: In a sleepy little mill town in North Carolina, Paul is the town Romeo. But when his best friend's sister returns home from boarding school, he finds himself falling for her innocent charm. In spite of her lack of experience and the violent protests of her brother, the two find themselves in a sweet, dreamy and all-consuming love.

crew: Rob Marshall, Lucy Liu, Richard Gere, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Queen Latifah, John C. Reilly, Renée Zellweger, Christine Baranski, Dominic West, Taye Diggs, Colm Feore
overview: Murderesses Velma Kelly and Roxie Hart find themselves on death row together and fight for the fame that will keep them from the gallows in 1920s Chicago.

crew: Zhang Yimou, Jet Li, Donnie Yen, James Hong, Tony Leung Chiu-wai, Zhang Ziyi, Chen Daoming, Maggie Cheung, Tianyong Zheng, Jin Ming, Zhongyuan Liu
overview: During China's Warring States period, a district prefect arrives at the palace of Qin Shi Huang, claiming to have killed the three assassins who had made an attempt on the king's life three years ago.

crew: Kevin Smith, Will Smith, Matt Damon, Ben Affleck, Liv Tyler, Jason Lee, Jennifer Lopez, Jason Biggs, George Carlin, Stephen Root, Harley Quinn Smith
overview: Ollie Trinke is a young, suave music publicist who seems to have it all, with a new wife and a baby on the way. But life deals him a bum hand when he's suddenly faced with single fatherhood, a defunct career and having to move in with his father. To bounce back, it takes a new love and the courage instilled in him by his daughter.

crew: Lukas Moodysson, Oksana Akinshina, Artyom Bogucharsky, Tõnu Kark, Madis Kalmet, Elina Benenson, Tomasz Neuman, Lyubov Agapova, Nikolai Bentsler, Pavel Ponomaryov, Liliya Shinkaryova
overview: Lilja lives in poverty and dreams of a better life. Her mother moves to the United States and abandons her to her aunt, who neglects her. Lilja hangs out with her friends, Natasha and Volodya, who is suicidal. Desperate for money, she starts working as a prostitute, and later meets Andrei. He offers her a good job in Sweden, but when Lilja arrives her life quickly enters a downward spiral.

crew: Lynne Ramsay, Samantha Morton, Dolly Wells, Yolanda Vazquez, James Wilson, Bryan Dick, Kathleen McDermott, Des Hamilton, Linda McGuire, Paul Popplewell, Vito Rocco
overview: After her boyfriend commits suicide, a young woman attempts to use the unpublished manuscript of a novel and a sum of money he left behind to reinvent her life.

crew: David Dobkin, Jackie Chan, Owen Wilson, Aidan Gillen, Donnie Yen, Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Gemma Jones, Barbara Nedeljakova, Anna-Louise Plowman, Tom Wu, Georgina Chapman
overview: The dynamic duo of Chon Wang and Roy O'Bannon return for another crazy adventure. This time, they're in London to avenge the murder of Chon's father, but end up on an even bigger case. Chon's sister is there to do the same, but instead unearths a plot to kill the royal family. No one believes her, though, and it's up to Chon and Roy (who has romance on his mind) to prove her right.

crew: John Stockwell, Michelle Rodriguez, Kate Bosworth, Matthew Davis, Faizon Love, Mika Boorem, Shaun Robinson, Kym Stys, Sanoe Lake, Kala Alexander, Chris Taloa
overview: Nothing gets between Anne Marie and her board. Living in a beach shack with three roommates, she is up before dawn every morning to conquer the waves and count the days until the Pipe Masters competition. Having transplanted herself to Hawaii with no one's blessing but her own, Anne Marie finds all she needs in the adrenaline-charged surf scene - until pro quarterback Matt Tollman comes along...

crew: Richard Donner, Gerard Butler, Neal McDonough, Paul Walker, Michael Sheen, Rossif Sutherland, David Thewlis, Marton Csokas, Anna Friel, Ethan Embry, Frances O'Connor
overview: A group of archaeological students become trapped in the past when they go there to retrieve their professor. The group must survive in 14th century France long enough to be rescued.

crew: Stephen Frears, Chiwetel Ejiofor, Benedict Wong, Audrey Tautou, Sophie Okonedo, Michael Mellinger, Adrian Scarborough, Zlatko Burić, Deobia Oparei, Darrell D'Silva, Sergi López
overview: An undocumented immigrant finds a human heart in one of the toilets of the west London hotel where he works with other undocumented immigrants.

crew: Wolfgang Becker, Daniel Brühl, Florian Lukas, Chulpan Khamatova, Christine Schorn, Alexander Beyer, Hans-Uwe Bauer, Jürgen Vogel, Peter Kurth, Michael Gwisdek, Maria Simon
overview: Alex Kerner's mother was in a coma while the Berlin wall fell. When she wakes up he must try to keep her from learning what happened (as she was an avid communist supporter) to avoid shocking her which could lead to another heart attack.

crew: Victor Salva, Justin Long, Ray Wise, Nicki Aycox, Eric Nenninger, Jonathan Breck, David Zepeda, Luke Edwards, Stephanie Denise Griffin, Diane Delano, Garikayi Mutambirwa
overview: When their bus is crippled on the side of a deserted road, a team of high school athletes discover an opponent they cannot defeat – and may not survive.

crew: Milorad Milinković, Srđan 'Žika' Todorović, Velimir Živojinović, Nikola Đuričko, Miodrag 'Miki' Krstović, Sonja Kolačarić, Mihajlo 'Bata' Paskaljević, Slobodan 'Boda' Ninković, Nenad Jezdić, Olivera Marković, Milica Mihajlović
overview: The basic plot revolves around drug dealer Limeni and two men, Lemi and Kiza, who are trying to transport their dead grandfather for burial, until their car breaks down and they end up struggling to get him home onboard a train. This is when these two plots intersect and all hell breaks loose.

crew: Matthew Ryan Hoge, Ryan Gosling, Sherilyn Fenn, Michelle Williams, Jena Malone, Lena Olin, Don Cheadle, Kerry Washington, Michael Peña, Kevin Spacey, Chris Klein
overview: A withdrawn young man, Leland Fitzgerald is imprisoned for the murder of a mentally disabled boy, who also happened to be the brother of his girlfriend, Becky. As the community struggles to deal with the killing, Pearl Madison, a teacher at the prison, decides to write about Leland's case. Meanwhile, others affected by the murder, including Becky and her sister, Julie, must contend with their own problems.

crew: Tom Brady, Rachel McAdams, Adam Sandler, Anna Faris, Rob Schneider, Lee Garlington, Michael O'Keefe, Melora Hardin, Tamera Mowry-Housley, Robert Davi, Alexandra Holden
overview: Not only is Jessica Spencer the most popular girl in school -- she is also the meanest. But things change for the attractive teen when a freak accident involving a cursed pair of earrings and a chance encounter at a gas station causes her to switch bodies with Clive, a sleazy crook. Jessica, in the form of the repulsive Clive, struggles to adjust to this radical alteration and sets out to get her own body back before the upcoming prom.

crew: Gus Van Sant, Matt Damon, Casey Affleck
overview: Two friends named Gerry become lost in the desert after taking a wrong turn. Their attempts to find their way home only lead them into further trouble.

crew: Lucky McKee, Anna Faris, James Duval, Jeremy Sisto, Will Estes, Nora Zehetner, Ken Davitian, Nichole Hiltz, Kevin Gage, Jennifer Grant, Merle Kennedy
overview: A socially awkward veterinary assistant with a lazy eye and obsession with perfection descends into depravity after developing a crush on a boy with perfect hands.

crew: Tim Story, Keith David, Michael Ealy, Cedric the Entertainer, Anthony Anderson, Ice Cube, Troy Garity, Jason George, Sean Patrick Thomas, Tom Wright, Parvesh Cheena
overview: A day in the life of a barbershop on the south side of Chicago. Calvin, who inherited the struggling business from his deceased father, views the shop as nothing but a burden and waste of his time. After selling the shop to a local loan shark, Calvin slowly begins to see his father's vision and legacy and struggles with the notion that he just sold it out.

crew: Eli Roth, Eli Roth, Cerina Vincent, Joey Kern, Rider Strong, Jordan Ladd, Giuseppe Andrews, James DeBello, Michael Harding, Richard Fullerton, Tim Parati
overview: A group of five college graduates rent a cabin in the woods and begin to fall victim to a horrifying flesh-eating virus, which attracts the unwanted attention of the homicidal locals.

crew: Charles Stone III, Zoe Saldaña, Jason Weaver, Orlando Jones, Nick Cannon, Leonard Roberts, Afemo Omilami, Angela Elayne Gibbs, Earl Poitier, Brandon Hirsch, Shay Roundtree
overview: A talented street drummer from Harlem enrolls in a Southern university, expecting to lead its marching band's drumline to victory. He initially flounders in his new world, before realizing that it takes more than talent to reach the top.

originalTitle: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
crew: Alfonso Cuarón, Gary Oldman, Emma Watson, Emma Thompson, Daniel Radcliffe, Fiona Shaw, Julie Walters, Alan Rickman, Tom Felton, Julie Christie, Rupert Grint
overview: Year three at Hogwarts means new fun and challenges as Harry learns the delicate art of approaching a Hippogriff, transforming shape-shifting Boggarts into hilarity and even turning back time. But the term also brings danger: soul-sucking Dementors hover over the school, an ally of the accursed He-Who-Cannot-Be-Named lurks within the castle walls, and fearsome wizard Sirius Black escapes Azkaban. And Harry will confront them all.

crew: Takashi Miike, Tetsuro Tamba, Naoto Takenaka, Kenichi Endo, Naomi Nishida, Keiko Matsuzaka, Moeko Ezawa, Kenji Sawada, Yoshiyuki Morishita, Shinji Takeda, Yoshiki Arizono
overview: The Katakuri family has just opened their guest house in the mountains. Unfortunately their first guest commits suicide and in order to avoid trouble they decide to bury him in the backyard. Things get way more complicated when their second guest, a famous sumo wrestler, dies while having sex with his underage girlfriend and the grave behind the house starts to fill up more and more.

crew: Mike Newell, Julia Roberts, Krysten Ritter, Kirsten Dunst, Maggie Gyllenhaal, Lily Rabe, Marcia Gay Harden, Topher Grace, Julia Stiles, Ginnifer Goodwin, Lisa Roberts Gillan
overview: Katherine Watson is a recent UCLA graduate hired to teach art history at the prestigious all-female Wellesley College, in 1953. Determined to confront the outdated mores of society and the institution that embraces them, Katherine inspires her traditional students, including Betty and Joan, to challenge the lives they are expected to lead.

crew: Michael Lembeck, Peter Boyle, Aisha Tyler, Tim Allen, Elizabeth Mitchell, David Krumholtz, Judge Reinhold, Wendy Crewson, Kevin Pollak, Michael Dorn, Blu Mankuma
overview: Better watch out! The big guy in red is coming to town once again. This time, Scott Calvin -- also known as Santa Claus -- finds out there's an obscure clause in his contract requiring him to take on a wife. He has to leave the North Pole to fulfill his obligations, or else he'll be forced to give up his Yuletide gig.

crew: Brian Helgeland, Peter Weller, Mark Addy, Heath Ledger, Shannyn Sossamon, Rosalinda Celentano, Mattia Sbragia, Benno Fürmann, Richard Bremmer, Maria Cristina Maccà, Alessandra Costanzo
overview: For centuries, a secret Order of priests has existed within the Church. A renegade priest, Father Alex Bernier, is sent to Rome to investigate the mysterious death of one of the Order's most revered members. Following a series of strangely similar killings, Bernier launches an investigation that forces him to confront unimaginable evil.

crew: Robert Pulcini, Shari Springer Berman, Hope Davis, Paul Giamatti, Donal Logue, Josh Hutcherson, Ebon Moss-Bachrach, James Urbaniak, Molly Shannon, Judah Friedlander, James McCaffrey, Earl Billings
overview: An original mix of fiction and reality illuminates the life of comic book hero everyman Harvey Pekar.

crew: Peter Segal, Marisa Tomei, Jack Nicholson, Woody Harrelson, Adam Sandler, Heather Graham, Harry Dean Stanton, John C. Reilly, John Turturro, Krista Allen, Kevin Nealon
overview: After a small misunderstanding aboard an airplane escalates out of control, timid businessman Dave Buznik is ordered by the court to undergo anger management therapy at the hands of specialist Dr. Buddy Rydell. But when Buddy steps up his aggressive treatment by moving in, Dave goes from mild to wild as the unorthodox treatment wreaks havoc with his life.

crew: Adam Shankman, Angus T. Jones, Queen Latifah, Steve Martin, Jean Smart, Steve Harris, Missi Pyle, Michael Rosenbaum, Joan Plowright, Betty White, Victor Webster
overview: Uptight lawyer Peter Sanderson wants to dive back into dating after his divorce and has a hard time meeting the right women. He tries online dating and lucks out when he starts chatting with a fellow lawyer. The two agree to meet in the flesh, but the woman he meets — an escaped African-American convict named Charlene — is not what he expected. Peter is freaked out, but Charlene tries to convinces him to take her case and prove her innocence. Along the way, she wreaks havoc on his middle-class life as he gets a lesson in learning to lighten up.

crew: Shawn Levy, Brittany Murphy, Raymond J. Barry, Veronica Cartwright, Ashton Kutcher, David Rasche, Taran Killam, Christian Kane, Monet Mazur, George Gaynes, David Moscow
overview: Tom Leezak and Sarah McNerney fall in love and plan to get married, despite opposition from Sarah's uptight, rich family. When they do get married, and get a chance to prove Sarah's family wrong, they go on a European honeymoon and run into disaster after disaster. They have to decide whether the honeymoon from hell and a few pre-marital mistakes are worth throwing away their love and marriage.

crew: Vipul Amrutlal Shah, Akshay Kumar, Bipasha Basu, Sushmita Sen, Amitabh Bachchan, Arjun Rampal, Paresh Rawal, Kashmera Shah, Aditya Pancholi
overview: After his hatred of dishonesty costs him his job, an embittered man goes over to the dark side and plots to rob the bank he once managed.

crew: Andrzej Bartkowiak, Jet Li, Daniel Dae Kim, Chi McBride, Gabrielle Union, Mark Dacascos, Kelly Hu, Tom Arnold, Anthony Anderson, Randy Couture, DMX
overview: Gang leader Tony pulls off a major diamond heist with his crew, but cop-turned-criminal Ling knows who has the loot and responds by kidnapping Tony's daughter and holding her for ransom. Unfortunately, Tony's lost the diamonds as well. As he frantically searches for his daughter and the jewels, Tony pairs with a high-kicking government agent who once worked with Ling and seeks revenge on him.

crew: Jim Fall, Evangeline Lilly, Katy Louise Saunders, Hilary Duff, Robert Carradine, Alex Borstein, Antonio Cupo, Jake Thomas, Ona Grauer, Adam Lamberg, Peter Kelamis
overview: Lizzie McGuire has graduated from middle school and takes a trip to Rome, Italy with her class. And what was supposed to be only a normal trip, becomes a teenager's dream come true.

crew: Kim Ki-duk, Namkoong Min, Kim Jung-young, Cho Jae-hyun, Choi Deok-moon, Lee Han-wi, Choi Yoon-young, Kim Yun-tae, Seo Won, Yoo-jin Shin, Kim Yun-tae
overview: A pimp enforcer takes revenge on a woman who rejected his advances by tricking her into prostitution, but complications arise.

crew: Bibo Bergeron, Rob Letterman, Vicky Jenson, Will Smith, Angelina Jolie, Robert De Niro, Jack Black, Peter Falk, Martin Scorsese, Michael Imperioli, Renée Zellweger, Doug E. Doug, Phil LaMarr
overview: Oscar is a small fish whose big aspirations often get him into trouble. Meanwhile, Lenny is a great white shark with a surprising secret that no sea creature would guess: He's a vegetarian. When a lie turns Oscar into an improbable hero and Lenny becomes an outcast, the two form an unlikely friendship.

crew: Steven Soderbergh, George Clooney, Natascha McElhone, Jeremy Davies, Elpidia Carrillo, Viola Davis, John Cho, Ulrich Tukur, Michael Ensign, Kent Faulcon, Lauren Cohn
overview: A troubled psychologist is sent to investigate the crew of an isolated research station orbiting a bizarre planet.

crew: Spike Lee, Rosario Dawson, Barry Pepper, Edward Norton, Brian Cox, Dania Ramirez, Isiah Whitlock Jr., Philip Seymour Hoffman, Anna Paquin, Vanessa Ferlito, Aaron Stanford
overview: In New York City in the days following the events of 9/11, Monty Brogan is a convicted drug dealer about to start a seven-year prison sentence, and his final hours of freedom are devoted to hanging out with his closest buddies and trying to prepare his girlfriend for his extended absence.

crew: Terry Zwigoff, Billy Bob Thornton, John Ritter, Octavia Spencer, Cloris Leachman, Alex Borstein, Billy Gardell, Lauren Tom, Lauren Graham, Bernie Mac, Matt Walsh
overview: A miserable conman and his partner pose as Santa and his Little Helper to rob department stores on Christmas Eve. But they run into problems when the conman befriends a troubled kid.

crew: Emilio Estevez, Anthony Hopkins, Lindsay Lohan, Helen Hunt, Laurence Fishburne, Elijah Wood, Mary Elizabeth Winstead, William H. Macy, Demi Moore, Shia LaBeouf, Heather Graham
overview: In 1968 the lives of a retired doorman, hotel manager, lounge singer, busboy, beautician and others intersect in the wake of Robert F. Kennedy's assassination at the Ambassador Hotel in Los Angeles.

crew: Hideo Nakata, Fumiyo Kohinata, Hitomi Kuroki, Kiriko Shimizu, Asami Mizukawa, Rio Kanno, Chisako Hara, Tarô Suwa, Chihiro Ohtsuka, Yuu Tokui, Tōru Shinagawa
overview: A woman in the midst of an unpleasant divorce moves to an eerie apartment building with her young daughter. The ceiling of their apartment has a dark and active leak.

crew: Robert Benton, Nicole Kidman, Anthony Hopkins, Anne Dudek, Ed Harris, Wentworth Miller, Margo Martindale, Clark Gregg, Harry Lennix, Jacinda Barrett, Kerry Washington
overview: Coleman Silk is a worldly and admired professor who loses his job after unwittingly making a racial slur. To clear his name, Silk writes a book about the events with his friend and colleague Nathan Zuckerman, who in the process discovers a dark secret Silk has hidden his whole life. All the while, Silk engages in an affair with Faunia Farley, a younger woman whose tormented past threatens to unravel the layers of deception Silk has constructed.

crew: John Schultz, Crispin Glover, Lance Barber, Jesse Plemons, Robert Forster, Morris Chestnut, Fred Armisen, Brenda Song, Reginald VelJohnson, Shad Moss, Jonathan Lipnicki
overview: Calvin and his friends, who all live in an orphanage, find old shoes with the faded letters MJ connected to a powerline. One stormy night, they go to get the shoes when Calvin and the shoes are struck by lightning. Calvin now has unbelievable basketball powers and has the chance to play for the NBA.

crew: Marc Forster, Johnny Depp, Kate Winslet, Freddie Highmore, Radha Mitchell, Toby Jones, Julie Christie, Dustin Hoffman, Kelly Macdonald, Tobias Menzies, Paul Whitehouse
overview: During a writing slump, playwright J.M. Barrie meets a widow and her four children, all young boys—who soon become an important part of Barrie’s life and the inspiration that lead him to create his masterpiece. Peter Pan.

crew: Neil LaBute, Rachel Weisz, Paul Rudd, Gretchen Mol, Frederick Weller
overview: Quiet, unassuming Adam is changing in a major way, thanks to his new girlfriend, art student Evelyn. Adam's friends are a little freaked by the transformation.

crew: Clint Eastwood, Clint Eastwood, Jeff Daniels, Anjelica Huston, Dylan Walsh, Glenn Morshower, Rick Hoffman, Wanda De Jesus, Paul Rodríguez, Igor Jijikine, Chao Li Chi
overview: Still recovering from a heart transplant, a retired FBI profiler returns to service when his own blood analysis offers clues to the identity of a serial killer.

crew: Peyton Reed, Ewan McGregor, Lynn Collins, Ivana Miličević, Jeri Ryan, Melissa George, David Hyde Pierce, Timothy Omundson, Renée Zellweger, Sarah Paulson, Chris Parnell
overview: In 1962 New York City, love blossoms between a playboy journalist and a feminist advice author.

Once lack of luck and resources happen, they begin to wage an exhilarating battle to survive and escape before the Umbrella Corporation erases its experiment from the face of the earth.

A court case hangs over him relating to a shipyard lamp he smashed during a protest against the closure. José is bitter that his wife, Ana, is employed when he is not.

crew: Ridley Scott, Liam Neeson, Eva Green, Nikolaj Coster-Waldau, Orlando Bloom, Jeremy Irons, Michael Sheen, Edward Norton, Brendan Gleeson, Alexander Siddig, Kevin McKidd

overview: Vampires and werewolves have waged a nocturnal war against each other for centuries. But all bets are off when a female vampire warrior named Selene, who's famous for her strength and werewolf-hunting prowess, becomes smitten with a peace-loving male werewolf, Michael, who wants to end the war.

crew: John Singleton, Cole Hauser, Paul Walker, James Remar, Eva Mendes, Tyrese Gibson, Mark Boone Junior, Devon Aoki, Michael Ealy, Mo Gallini, Ludacris

But the guys are actually working with undercover agent Monica Fuentes to bring Verone down.

crew: Emir Kusturica, Aleksandar Berček, Nikola Kojo, Vuk Kostić, Dr. Nele Karajlić, Slavko Štimac, Vesna Trivalić, Nataša Tapušković, Mirjana Karanović, Adnan Omerović, Davor Janjić

Then Luka's son is conscripted and eventually captured in the fighting. To recover his son, Luka is commanded to guard a pretty young Muslim nurse who will be used in a hostage swapping operation.

crew: Bille Woodruff, Jessica Alba, Mekhi Phifer, Joy Bryant, David Moscow, Lonette McKee, Romeo Miller, Jordan Madley, Kevin Duhaney, Ginuwine, Anthony Sherwood

Honey thinks she's hit the jackpot when she meets a hotshot director casts her in one of his music videos. But, when he starts demanding sexual favors from her, Honey makes a decision that will change her life.

crew: Farhan Akhtar, Preity Zinta, Amrish Puri, Hrithik Roshan, Amitabh Bachchan, Nawab Shah, Lillete Dubey, Boman Irani, Parmeet Sethi, Om Puri, Aditya Srivastava

crew: Peter Howitt, Julianne Moore, Pierce Brosnan, Michael Sheen, Frances Fisher, Parker Posey, David Pearse, David Wilmot, Mike Doyle, David Kelly, Sean Brosnan
overview: Amidst a sea of litigation, two New York City divorce lawyers find love.

They figure a good way of doing this is taking down Dean "The Dean" Stevens, a well-known cardsharp, in a rigged game. However, they first need enough money to enter a game with Stevens, so they decide to strike a deal with fellow crook Larry Jennings to scam a local gangster -- which turns out to be a bad idea.

crew: Billy Ray, Hayden Christensen, Peter Sarsgaard, Steve Zahn, Rosario Dawson, Hank Azaria, Melanie Lynskey, Caroline Goodall, Chloë Sevigny, Chad Donella, Andrew Airlie

Award-winning director Ulf Malmros helms this black comedy infused with hipster flair.

Michele's parents learn of his discovery and warn him to forget what he saw

This birthright proves itself to be quite the curse once Ella finds herself in the hands of several unscrupulous characters whom she quite literally cannot disobey. Determined to gain control of her life and decisions, Ella sets off on a journey to find her fairy godmother who she hopes will lift the curse. The path, however, isn't easy -- Ella must outwit a slew of unpleasant obstacles including ogres, giants, wicked stepsisters, elves and Prince Charmont's evil uncle, who wants to take over the crown and rule the kingdom.

With his steely disposition, Beck is a man of few words -- but it takes him all the discipline he can muster to work with Travis to nab a tyrant who's after the same treasure.

crew: Tony Scott, Denzel Washington, Dakota Fanning, Christopher Walken, Radha Mitchell, Mickey Rourke, Rachel Ticotin, Marc Anthony, Giancarlo Giannini, Gerardo Taracena, Angelina Peláez

crew: Gary Ross, Tobey Maguire, Elizabeth Banks, Jeff Bridges, William H. Macy, Chris Cooper, Michael B. Silver, Michael Angarano, Michael O'Neill, Valerie Mahaffey, Eddie Jones
overview: True story of the undersized Depression-era racehorse whose victories lifted not only the spirits of the team behind it but also those of their nation.

crew: Ron Shelton, Lou Diamond Phillips, Harrison Ford, Josh Hartnett, Brianna Brown, Anthony Mackie, Keith David, Lena Olin, Bruce Greenwood, Martin Landau, Alan Dale
overview: Joe Gavilan and his new partner K. C. Calden, are detectives on the beat in Tinseltown. Neither one of them really wants to be a cop, Gavilan moonlights as a real estate broker, and Calden is an aspiring actor moonlighting as a yoga instructor. When the two are assigned a big case they must work out whether they want to solve the case or follow their hearts.

crew: Takeshi Kitano, Nao Omori, Hochu Otsuka, Hidetoshi Nishijima, Kyoko Fukada, Ren Osugi, Kayoko Kishimoto, Morooka Moro, Kanji Tsuda, Mari Nishio, Miho Kanno
overview: Dolls takes puppeteering as its overriding motif, which relates thematically to the action provided by the live characters. Chief among those tales is the story of Matsumoto and Sawako, a young couple whose relationship is about to be broken apart by the former's parents, who have insisted their son take part in an arranged marriage to his boss' daughter.

crew: Marek Koterski, Cezary Pazura, Piotr Fronczewski, Marek Kondrat, Marcin Troński, Violetta Arlak, Anna Powierza, Andrzej Grabowski, Andrzej Mastalerz, Janina Traczykówna, Anna Przybylska
overview: It is a bitter story about a middle-aged man, who hates his life and other people, including himself. Adam Miauczynski, the character known from director Marek Koterski's previous films, is a 44 year-old teacher, who reads poetry during school lessons and later goes home swearing and calling his neighbours' names. The worst pain for him is the next 5 minutes of living. He doesn't accept himself and even everyday contacts with others cause his aggression. Though constantly dreaming of a romantic love, he is not bold enough to make his dreams come true. The desperate Miauczynski personalizes our own fears and obsessions, which have become so visible recently.

originalTitle: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
crew: Mike Newell, Gary Oldman, Emma Watson, Daniel Radcliffe, Robert Pattinson, Ralph Fiennes, Shirley Henderson, Alan Rickman, Tom Felton, Jason Isaacs, Rupert Grint
overview: When Harry Potter's name emerges from the Goblet of Fire, he becomes a competitor in a grueling battle for glory among three wizarding schools—the Triwizard Tournament. But since Harry never submitted his name for the Tournament, who did? Now Harry must confront a deadly dragon, fierce water demons and an enchanted maze only to find himself in the cruel grasp of He Who Must Not Be Named.

crew: Jonathan Hensleigh, John Travolta, Will Patton, Laura Harring, Rebecca Romijn, Thomas Jane, Roy Scheider, Samantha Mathis, Jeff Chase, Hank Stone, Ben Foster

However, when a masked villain steals costumes of classic monsters on display and brings them to life, the gang must come out of retirement to solve the case.

Their romance goes well until baseball season begins, and Lindsey soon realizes that Ben is completely obsessed with the Boston Red Sox. Though she tries to understand Ben's passionate team loyalty, eventually it threatens to end their otherwise happy relationship.

crew: Gil Junger, Jennifer Love Hewitt, Tom Wilkinson, Terence Harvey, Pippa Haywood, Stewart Wright, Diana Hardcastle, Neville Phillips, Paul Nicholls, Danny Babington, Oscar James
overview: After his impetuous musician girlfriend, Samantha, dies in an accident shortly after they had a fight (and nearly broke up), a grief-stricken British businessman, Ian Wyndham, living in London gets a chance to relive the day all over again, in the hope of changing the events that led up to her getting killed.

crew: Nick Cassavetes, Ryan Gosling, Rachel McAdams, James Marsden, Joan Allen, James Garner, Gena Rowlands, Sam Shepard, Jamie Anne Allman, Paul Johansson, Kevin Connolly
overview: An epic love story centered around an older man who reads aloud to a woman with Alzheimer's. From a faded notebook, the old man's words bring to life the story about a couple who is separated by World War II, and is then passionately reunited, seven years later, after they have taken different paths.

crew: Brian Dannelly, Mary-Louise Parker, Eva Amurri Martino, Jena Malone, Macaulay Culkin, Mandy Moore, Heather Matarazzo, Patrick Fugit, Valerie Bertinelli, Martin Donovan, Elizabeth Thai
overview: Mary is a good Christian girl who goes to a good Christian high school where she has good Christian friends and a perfect Christian boyfriend. Her life seems perfect, until the day that she finds out that her boyfriend may be gay — and that she’s pregnant.

crew: Richard Linklater, Jack Black, Miranda Cosgrove, Joan Cusack, Frank Whaley, Sarah Silverman, Mike White, Heather Goldenhersh, Nicky Katt, Amy Sedaris, Aleisha Allen
overview: Fired from his band and hard up for cash, guitarist and vocalist Dewey Finn finagles his way into a job as a fifth-grade substitute teacher at a private school, where he secretly begins teaching his students the finer points of rock 'n' roll. The school's hard-nosed principal is rightly suspicious of Finn's activities. But Finn's roommate remains in the dark about what he's doing.

crew: Wolfgang Petersen, Brad Pitt, Eric Bana, Diane Kruger, Rose Byrne, Orlando Bloom, Sean Bean, Julie Christie, Peter O'Toole, Vincent Regan, Brendan Gleeson

After Menelaus finds out that his wife was taken by the Trojans, he asks his brother Agamemnon to help him get her back. Agamemnon sees this as an opportunity for power. They set off with 1,000 ships holding 50,000 Greeks to Troy.

With Irish guts and grit, lives collide, preconceptions shatter and romance is tested to the extreme. An ill-timed and poorly executed couple's break-up sets off a chain of events affecting everyone in town.

crew: Zach Braff, Natalie Portman, Peter Sarsgaard, Jim Parsons, Jean Smart, Zach Braff, Denis O'Hare, Ian Holm, Geoffrey Arend, Method Man, Michael Weston

The trip coincides with his decision to stop taking his powerful antidepressants. A chance meeting with Sam - a girl also suffering from various maladies - opens up the possibility of rekindling emotional attachments, confronting his psychologist father, and perhaps beginning a new life.

overview: Join uptight David Starsky and laid-back Ken "Hutch" Hutchinson as they're paired for the first time as undercover cops. The new partners must overcome their differences to solve an important case with help from street informant Huggy Bear and persuasive criminal Reese Feldman.

originalTitle: Win a Date with Tad Hamilton!
crew: Robert Luketic, Josh Duhamel, Amy Smart, Gary Cole, Topher Grace, Kate Bosworth, Ginnifer Goodwin, Kathryn Hahn, Stephen Tobolowsky, Jordana Brewster, Moon Bloodgood
overview: A small-town girl wins a date with a Hollywood star through a contest. When the date goes better than expected, a love triangle forms between the girl, the celebrity, and the girl's best friend.

crew: James Cox, Ted Levine, Val Kilmer, Lisa Kudrow, Tim Blake Nelson, Kate Bosworth, Scoot McNairy, Dylan McDermott, Carrie Fisher, Josh Lucas, Christina Applegate
overview: On the afternoon of July 1, 1981, Los Angeles police responded to a distress call on Wonderland Avenue and discovered a grisly quadruple homicide. The police investigation that followed uncovered two versions of the events leading up to the brutal murders - both involving legendary porn actor John Holmes.

originalTitle: Les rivières pourpres II - Les anges de l'apocalypse
crew: Olivier Dahan, Jean Reno, Benoît Magimel, Christopher Lee, Johnny Hallyday, Gabrielle Lazure, Cyril Raffaelli, Ériq Ebouaney, Jo Prestia, Camille Natta, Francis Renaud
overview: No one is safe when seemingly random killings emerge as a deadly pattern intended to usher in the end of the world.  A murder victim with the same DNA as Christ. A serial killer mimicking the deaths of the 12 Apostles. Inspector Niemans and a young, rebellious detective team up with a beautiful expert in religion to crack the case before their elusive suspect completes the cycle of terror, paving the way to an even bigger bloody catastrophe.

crew: Gary Winick, Jennifer Garner, Andy Serkis, Lynn Collins, Judy Greer, Brie Larson, Mark Ruffalo, Alexandra Kyle, Ashley Benson, Brittany Curran, Robinne Lee
overview: A girl who's sick of the social strictures of junior high is transformed into a grownup overnight. In this feel-good fairy tale, teenager Jenna wants a boyfriend, and when she's unable to find one, she fantasizes about being a well-adjusted adult. Suddenly, her secret desire becomes a reality, and she is transformed into a 30-year-old, but adulthood, with its own set of male-female challenges, isn't as easy as it looks.

crew: Ravi Chopra, Salman Khan, Amitabh Bachchan, Rimi Sen, Hema Malini, Sharat Saxena, Lillete Dubey, Divya Dutta, Paresh Rawal, Sanjeeda Sheikh, Govardhan Asrani
overview: After dedicating their whole life in upbringing their children, elderly couple Raj Malhotra and Pooja gets homeless. Instead of caring, their children treat them as a burden.

crew: Kevin Rodney Sullivan, Queen Latifah, Michael Ealy, Keke Palmer, Cedric the Entertainer, Kenan Thompson, Harry Lennix, Ice Cube, Robert Wisdom, Troy Garity, Sean Patrick Thomas
overview: The continuing adventures of the barbers at Calvin's Barbershop. Gina, a stylist at the beauty shop next door, is now trying to cut in on his business. Calvin is again struggling to keep his father's shop and traditions alive--this time against urban developers looking to replace mom & pop establishments with name-brand chains. The world changes, but some things never go out of style--from current events and politics to relationships and love, you can still say anything you want at the barbershop.

crew: Walter Salles, Kristen Stewart, Alice Braga, Steve Buscemi, Terrence Howard, Kirsten Dunst, Amy Adams, Viggo Mortensen, Elisabeth Moss, Tom Sturridge, Giselle Itié
overview: Dean and Sal are the portrait of the Beat Generation. Their search for "It" results in a fast paced, energetic roller coaster ride with highs and lows throughout the U.S.

crew: Martha Coolidge, Julia Stiles, Winter Ave Zoli, Eliza Bennett, Miranda Richardson, Ben Miller, Devin Ratray, Zachary Knighton, James Fox, Amy Stewart, Alberta Watson
overview: A fairy tale love-story about pre-med student Paige who falls in love with a Danish Prince "Eddie" who refused to follow the traditions of his parents and has come to the US to quench his thirst for rebellion. Paige and Edward come from two different worlds, but there is an undeniable attraction between them.

crew: Charles Martin Smith, James Cromwell, Barry Pepper, Jon Gries, William MacDonald, Kiersten Warren, Malcolm Scott, Greg Spottiswood, Annabella Piugattuk, Robin Dunne, Michael Bublé
overview: A bush pilot in nothern Canada who with the aid of modernity thinks he can handle it all & knows it all. After reluctantly agreeing to transport a local indian girl to a medical facility his light plane crashes & they have to survive whilst finding their way back to civilization. Along the journey the man finds a new respect for the native ways as they battle to survive the elements.

crew: Nancy Meyers, Keanu Reeves, Jack Nicholson, Rachel Ticotin, Diane Keaton, Amanda Peet, Jon Favreau, Frances McDormand, T.J. Thyne, Patrick Fischler, Audrey Wasilewski
overview: Harry Sanborn is an aged music industry exec with a fondness for younger women like Marin, his latest trophy girlfriend. Things get a little awkward when Harry suffers a heart attack at the home of Marin's mother, Erica. Left in the care of Erica and his doctor, a love triangle starts to take shape.

crew: Jonathan Glazer, Nicole Kidman, Ted Levine, Danny Huston, Peter Stormare, Anne Heche, Lauren Bacall, Cameron Bright, Arliss Howard, Cara Seymour, Alison Elliott
overview: It took Anna 10 years to recover from the death of her husband, Sean, but now she's on the verge of marrying her boyfriend, Joseph, and finally moving on. However, on the night of her engagement party, a young boy named Sean turns up, saying he is her dead husband reincarnated. At first she ignores the child, but his knowledge of her former husband's life is uncanny, leading her to believe that he might be telling the truth.

crew: Nigel Cole, Helen Mirren, Julie Walters, Ciarán Hinds, Geraldine James, Patton Oswalt, Jay Leno, Linda Bassett, Adil Hussain, Celia Imrie, Philip Glenister
overview: Members of a Yorkshire branch of the Women's Institute cause controversy when they pose nude for a charity calendar.

crew: Bart Freundlich, Kristen Stewart, Max Thieriot, Jennifer Beals, Sam Robards, John Carroll Lynch, Dawn Lewis, James Le Gros, Michael Des Barres, Kane Ritchotte, Audrey Wasilewski
overview: Athletic twelve-year-old Maddy shares an enthusiasm for mountain climbing with her father Tom. Unfortunately, Tom suffers a spinal injury while scaling Mount Everest, and his family is unable to afford the surgery that can save him. Maddy decides to get the money for her father's operation by robbing a high-security bank. She relies on her climbing skills and help from her friends to pull it off successfully.

crew: David R. Ellis, Jason Statham, Chris Evans, Jessica Biel, William H. Macy, Kim Basinger, Al Sapienza, Rick Hoffman, Richard Burgi, Noah Emmerich, Valerie Cruz
overview: A young man receives an emergency phone call on his cell phone from an older woman. She claims to have been kidnapped – and the kidnappers have targeted her husband and child next.

crew: Len Wiseman, Bruce Willis, Mary Elizabeth Winstead, Timothy Olyphant, Justin Long, Maggie Q, Jake McDorman, Cliff Curtis, Christina Chang, Sung Kang, Chris Ellis
overview: John McClane is back and badder than ever, and this time he's working for Homeland Security. He calls on the services of a young hacker in his bid to stop a ring of Internet terrorists intent on taking control of America's computer infrastructure.

originalTitle: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
crew: Michel Gondry, Kate Winslet, Kirsten Dunst, Jim Carrey, Elijah Wood, Jane Adams, Mark Ruffalo, Tom Wilkinson, David Cross, Amir Ali Said, Deirdre O'Connell
overview: Joel Barish, heartbroken that his girlfriend underwent a procedure to erase him from her memory, decides to do the same. However, as he watches his memories of her fade away, he realises that he still loves her, and may be too late to correct his mistake.

crew: Casey La Scala, Jennifer Morrison, Jason London, Adam Brody, Stephen Root, Vince Vieluf, Randy Quaid, Joey Kern, Mike Vogel, Christine Estabrook, Christopher McDonald
overview: Four skaters follow their idol on his summer tour in an attempt to get noticed, get sponsored, and become stars themselves.

crew: Alexandre Aja, Maïwenn, Cécile de France, Philippe Nahon, Gabriel Spahiu, Andrei Finti, Bogdan Uritescu, Franck Khalfoun, Jean-Claude de Goros, Oana Pellea, Marco Claudiu Pascu
overview: Best friends Marie and Alexia decide to spend a quiet weekend at Alexia's parents' secluded farmhouse. But on the night of their arrival, the girls' idyllic getaway turns into an endless night of horror.

crew: John Duigan, Charlize Theron, Rachelle Lefevre, Steven Berkoff, Penélope Cruz, Thomas Kretschmann, Karine Vanasse, Stuart Townsend, David La Haye, Gabriel Hogan, Amy Sloan
overview: Gilda Bessé shares her Paris apartment with an Irish schoolteacher, Guy Malyon, and Mia, a refugee from Spain. As the world drifts toward war, Gilda defiantly pursues her hedonistic lifestyle and her burgeoning career as a photographer. But Guy and Mia feel impelled to join the fight against fascism, and the three friends are separated.

crew: Denys Arcand, Marie-Josée Croze, Roy Dupuis, Marina Hands, Johanne-Marie Tremblay, Rémy Girard, Yves Jacques, Stéphane Rousseau, Daniel Brière, Denys Arcand, Frédéric Gilles
overview: In this belated sequel to 'The Decline of the American Empire', middle-aged Montreal college professor, Remy, learns that he is dying of liver cancer. His ex-wife, Louise, asks their estranged son, Sebastian, a successful businessman living in London, to come home. Sebastian makes the impossible happen, using his contacts and disrupting the Canadian healthcare system in every way possible to help his father fight his terminal illness to the bitter end, while reuniting some of Remy's old friends, including Pierre, Alain, Dominique, Diane, and Claude, who return to see their friend before he passes on.

crew: Ron Howard, Tommy Lee Jones, Val Kilmer, Cate Blanchett, Clint Howard, Evan Rachel Wood, Ray McKinnon, Aaron Eckhart, Elisabeth Moss, Eric Schweig, Jenna Boyd
overview: When rancher and single mother of two Maggie Gilkeson sees her teenage daughter, Lily, kidnapped by Apache rebels, she reluctantly accepts the help of her estranged father, Samuel, in tracking down the kidnappers. Along the way, the two must learn to reconcile the past and work together if they are going to have any hope of getting Lily back before she is taken over the border and forced to become a prostitute.

crew: Curtis Hanson, Robert Downey Jr., Eric Bana, Robert Duvall, Michael Shannon, Jean Smart, Drew Barrymore, Debra Messing, Evan Jones, Omar Benson Miller, Joey Kern
overview: A professional poker player whose astounding luck at the table fails to translate into his lonesome love life attempts to win the World Series of Poker while simultaneously earning the affections of a beautiful Las Vegas singer.

crew: Mikael Håfström, Gustaf Skarsgård, Marie Richardson, Björn Granath, Filip Berg, Linda Zilliacus, Kjell Bergqvist, Mats Bergman, Lennart Hjulström, Ulf Friberg, Andreas Wilson
overview: Stockholm, the fifties. Though academically bright, violent pupil Erik Ponti is expelled from his state school with the headmaster’s words “there’s only one word for people like you – evil… what you need is a good thrashing, and more”. In fact already Erik frequently receives a ‘good’ thrashing at the hands of his sadistic stepfather – so he is packed off by his mother to boardingschool

crew: John Woo, Uma Thurman, Ben Affleck, Michael C. Hall, Callum Keith Rennie, Paul Giamatti, Aaron Eckhart, Ivana Miličević, Krista Allen, Ryan Robbins, Kathryn Morris
overview: Michael Jennings is a genius who's hired – and paid handsomely – by high-tech firms to work on highly sensitive projects, after which his short-term memory is erased so he's incapable of breaching security. But at the end of a three-year job, he's told he isn't getting a paycheck and instead receives a mysterious envelope. In it are clues he must piece together to find out why he wasn't paid – and why he's now in hot water.

crew: Robert Zemeckis, Tom Hanks, Michael Jeter, Josh Hutcherson, Eddie Deezen, Charles Fleischer, Daryl Sabara, Jimmy Bennett, Peter Scolari, Ed Gale, Nona Gaye
overview: When a doubting young boy takes an extraordinary train ride to the North Pole, he embarks on a journey of self-discovery that shows him that the wonder of life never fades for those who believe.

crew: Anand Tucker, Steve Martin, Rachel Nichols, Claire Danes, Bridgette Wilson-Sampras, Jason Schwartzman, Frances Conroy, Sam Bottoms, Romy Rosemont, Rebecca Pidgeon, Emily Kuroda
overview: Mirabelle is a disenchanted salesgirl and aspiring artist who sells gloves and accessories at a department store. She has two men in her life: wealthy divorcée Ray Porter and struggling musician Jeremy. Mirabelle falls in love with the glamorous Ray, and her life takes a magical turn, but eventually she realizes that she must empower herself and make a choice between them.

crew: Bobby Farrelly, Peter Farrelly, Matt Damon, Kiele Sanchez, Rhona Mitra, Bella Thorne, Eva Mendes, Meryl Streep, Doug Jones, Greg Kinnear, Luke Wilson, Dane Cook
overview: In Martha's Vineyard, Mass., conjoined twins Walt and Bob Tenor make the best of their handicap by being the fastest grill cooks in town. While outgoing Walt hopes to one day become a famous actor, shy Bob prefers to stay out of the spotlight. When a fading Hollywood actress, Cher, decides to get her show "Honey and the Beaze" cancelled, she hires Walt -- and his brotherly appendage -- as her costars. But their addition surprisingly achieves the opposite.

crew: Jean-Jacques Annaud, Freddie Highmore, Guy Pearce, Moussa Maaskri, Jean-Claude Dreyfus, Philippine Leroy-Beaulieu, Maï Anh Le, David Gant, Juliet Howland, Teerawat Mulvilai, Bô Gaultier de Kermoal
overview: Two tigers are separated as cubs and taken into captivity, only to be reunited years later as enemies by an explorer (Pearce) who inadvertently forces them to fight each other.

crew: Stephen Sommers, Kate Beckinsale, Hugh Jackman, David Wenham, Robbie Coltrane, Samuel West, Elena Anaya, Richard Roxburgh, Alun Armstrong, Kevin J. O'Connor, Zuzana Ďurdinová
overview: Famed monster slayer Gabriel Van Helsing is dispatched to Transylvania to assist the last of the Valerious bloodline in defeating Count Dracula. Anna Valerious reveals that Dracula has formed an unholy alliance with Dr. Frankenstein's monster and is hell-bent on exacting a centuries-old curse on her family.

crew: Alan Mak, Andrew Lau Wai-Keung, Andy Lau, Tony Leung Chiu-wai, Edison Chen, Lam Ka-tung, Anthony Wong Chau-Sang, Sammi Cheng, Eric Tsang, Dion Lam Dik-On, Shawn Yue, Tony Ho
overview: Chan Wing Yan, a young police officer, has been sent undercover as a mole in the local mafia. Lau Kin Ming, a young mafia member, infiltrates the police force. Years later, their older counterparts, Chen Wing Yan and Inspector Lau Kin Ming, respectively, race against time to expose the mole within their midst.

crew: Martin Scorsese, Leonardo DiCaprio, Kate Beckinsale, Willem Dafoe, Jude Law, Alec Baldwin, Danny Huston, Cate Blanchett, John C. Reilly, Alan Alda, Edward Herrmann
overview: A biopic depicting the life of filmmaker and aviation pioneer Howard Hughes from 1927 to 1947, during which time he became a successful film producer and an aviation magnate, while simultaneously growing more unstable due to severe obsessive-compulsive disorder.

crew: Ringo Lam, Jean-Claude Van Damme, Robert LaSardo, Milos Milicevic, Carlos Gómez, David Leitch, Paulo Tocha, Michael Bailey Smith, Julian Vergov, Kaloian Vodenicharov, Atanas Srebrev
overview: A man must survive a prison where hardened criminals battle to the death for the warden's entertainment.

crew: Josef Fares, Fares Fares, Sissela Kyle, Eva Röse, Torkel Petersson, Göran Ragnerstam, Erik Ahrnbom, Sven-Åke Gustavsson, Viktor Friberg, Christian Fiedler, Jan Fares
overview: A small Swedish village, Högboträsk, is so peaceful that crime is nonexistent. The police spend their shifts drinking coffee, eating hot dogs and chasing down runaway cows. This is all well and good for the village's own police, but the police management board wants to discontinue the local police force for lack of crime.

crew: Brad Silberling, Helena Bonham Carter, Jude Law, Jim Carrey, Emily Browning, Meryl Streep, Jennifer Coolidge, Amy Brenneman, Cedric the Entertainer, Dustin Hoffman, Catherine O'Hara
overview: Three wealthy children's parents are killed in a fire. When they are sent to a distant relative, they find out that he is plotting to kill them and seize their fortune.

crew: Charles Stone III, Chris Noth, Keegan-Michael Key, Angela Bassett, Tom Arnold, Paul Sorvino, Brian J. White, Carmen Electra, Evan Jones, Ian Anthony Dale, Neil Brown Jr.
overview: Aging baseball star who goes by the nickname, Mr. 3000, finds out many years after retirement that he didn't quite reach 3,000 hits. Now at age 47 he's back to try and reach that goal.

crew: Takashi Yamazaki, Kanata Hongo, Shugo Oshinari, Takeshi Kaneshiro, Anne Suzuki, Hoshi Ishida, Kirin Kiki, Goro Kishitani, Kisuke Iida, Adeyto, Yukiko Okamoto
overview: A young woman from the future forces a local gunman to help her stop an impending alien invasion which will wipe out the human race.

crew: Michael Spierig, Peter Spierig, Dirk Hunter, Mungo McKay, Robyn Moore, Rob Jenkins, Lisa Cunningham, Felicity Mason, Chintamani Lila, Emma Randall, Robert Jozinović, Peter Mensforth
overview: A quaint Australian fishing village is overcome by meteorites that turn its residents into the ravenous undead, leaving a small group of those unharmed to find a way out.

crew: István Szabó, Annette Bening, Jeremy Irons, Michael Gambon, Lucy Punch, Bruce Greenwood, Tom Sturridge, Max Irons, Julian Richings, Rita Tushingham, Miriam Margolyes
overview: Julia Lambert is a true diva: beautiful, talented, weathly and famous.  She has it all - including a devoted husband who has mastermined her brilliant career - but after years of shining in the spotlight she begins to suffer from a severe case of boredom and longs for something new and exciting to put the twinkle back in her eye.  Julia finds exactly what she's looking for in a handsome young American fan, but it isn't long before the novelty fling adds a few more sparks than she was hoping for.  Fortuately for her, this surprise twist in the plot will thrust her back into the greatest role of her life.

crew: Florent-Emilio Siri, Kim Coates, Bruce Willis, Robert Knepper, Glenn Morshower, Kevin Pollak, Jonathan Tucker, Michael D. Roberts, Jimmy Bennett, Rumer Willis, Sven-Ole Thorsen
overview: When a mafia accountant is taken hostage on his beat, a police officer – wracked by guilt from a prior stint as a negotiator – must negotiate the standoff, even as his own family is held captive by the mob.

crew: Patty Jenkins, Charlize Theron, Christina Ricci, Bruce Dern, Lee Tergesen, Pruitt Taylor Vince, Scott Wilson, Tim Ware, Kane Hodder, Annie Corley, Rus Blackwell
overview: An emotionally scarred highway drifter shoots a sadistic trick who rapes her, and ultimately becomes America's first female serial killer.

crew: Louis Leterrier, Morgan Freeman, Jet Li, Scott Adkins, Affif Ben Badra, Vincent Regan, Kerry Condon, Bob Hoskins, Phyllida Law, Georgina Chapman, Manu Lanzi
overview: Raised as a slave, Danny is used to fighting for his survival. In fact, his "master," Bart, thinks of him as a pet and goes as far as leashing him with a collar so they can make money in fight clubs, where Danny is the main contender. When Bart's crew is in a car accident, Danny escapes and meets a blind, kindhearted piano tuner who takes him in and uses music to free the fighter's long-buried heart.

crew: Thomas Vinterberg, Bill Pullman, Jamie Bell, Mark Webber, Michael Angarano, Alison Pill, Chris Owen, Trevor Cooper, Thomas Bo Larsen, Novella Nelson, William Hootkins
overview: In a blue-collar American town, a group of teens bands together to form the Dandies, a gang of gunslingers led by Dick Dandelion. Following a code of strict pacifism at odds with the fact that they all carry guns, the group eventually lets in Sebastian, the grandson of Dick's childhood nanny, Clarabelle, who fears the other gangs in the area. Dick and company try to protect Clarabelle, but events transpire that push the gang past posturing.

crew: Anders Thomas Jensen, Mads Mikkelsen, Nikolaj Lie Kaas, Jakob Cedergren, Lars Ranthe, Bodil Jørgensen, Nicolas Bro, Ole Thestrup, Tomas Villum Jensen, Kristian Halken, Line Kruse
overview: A black comedy featuring two butchers, Svend "Sweat" and Bjarne, who start their own shop to get away from their arrogant boss. Cannibalism is soon introduced to the plot, and further complications arise due to the reappearance of Bjarne's intellectually disabled twin brother Eigil.

crew: Lars von Trier, Willem Dafoe, Danny Glover, Bryce Dallas Howard, John Hurt, Jeremy Davies, Lauren Bacall, Chloë Sevigny, Nina Sosanya, Isaach De Bankolé, Zeljko Ivanek
overview: In 1933, after leaving Dogville, Grace Margaret Mulligan sees a slave being punished at a cotton farm called Manderlay. Officially, slavery is illegal and Grace stands up against the farmers. She stays with some gangsters in Manderlay and tries to influence the situation. But when harvest time comes, Grace sees the social and economic reality of Manderlay.

crew: John Hamburg, Kevin Hart, Alec Baldwin, Jennifer Aniston, Ben Stiller, Missi Pyle, Hank Azaria, Debra Messing, Bryan Brown, Philip Seymour Hoffman, Cheryl Hines
overview: Reuben Feffer is a guy who's spent his entire life playing it safe. Polly Prince is irresistible as a free-spirit who lives for the thrill of the moment. When these two comically mismatched souls collide, Reuben's world is turned upside down, as he makes an uproarious attempt to change his life from middle-of-the-road to totally-out-there.

crew: Peter Segal, Katheryn Winnick, Maya Rudolph, Adam Sandler, Lynn Collins, Dan Aykroyd, Sean Astin, Jackie Sandler, Missi Pyle, Drew Barrymore, Amy Hill
overview: Henry is a player skilled at seducing women. But when this veterinarian meets Lucy, a girl with a quirky problem when it comes to total recall, he realizes it's possible to fall in love all over again…and again, and again. That's because the delightful Lucy has no short-term memory, so Henry must woo her day after day until he finally sweeps her off her feet.

crew: Robert De Niro, Angelina Jolie, Matt Damon, Robert De Niro, Joe Pesci, Billy Crudup, Alec Baldwin, Gabriel Macht, Eddie Redmayne, Lee Pace, Michael Gambon
overview: Edward Wilson, the only witness to his father's suicide and member of the Skull and Bones Society while a student at Yale, is a morally upright young man who values honor and discretion, qualities that help him to be recruited for a career in the newly founded OSS. His dedication to his work does not come without a price though, leading him to sacrifice his ideals and eventually his family.

crew: Alex Proyas, Will Smith, Shia LaBeouf, Chi McBride, James Cromwell, Alan Tudyk, Bruce Greenwood, Emily Tennant, Bridget Moynahan, Terry Chen, Tiffany Lyndall-Knight
overview: In 2035, where robots are commonplace and abide by the three laws of robotics, a technophobic cop investigates an apparent suicide. Suspecting that a robot may be responsible for the death, his investigation leads him to believe that humanity may be in danger.

crew: Jean-Pierre Jeunet, Jodie Foster, Marion Cotillard, Audrey Tautou, Jean-Paul Rouve, Tchéky Karyo, Jean-Pierre Darroussin, Gaspard Ulliel, Dominique Pinon, Rufus, Dominique Bettenfeld
overview: Young Frenchwoman Mathilde searches for the truth about her missing fiancé, lost during World War I, and learns many unexpected things along the way. The love of her life is gone. But she refuses to believe he's gone forever — and she needs to know for sure.

crew: Luc Besson, Robert De Niro, Freddie Highmore, Jason Bateman, Erik Per Sullivan, Harvey Keitel, Emilio Estevez, Madonna, Rob Corddry, Snoop Dogg, Mia Farrow
overview: Arthur is a spirited ten-year old whose parents are away looking for work, whose eccentric grandfather has been missing for several years, and who lives with his grandmother in a country house that, in two days, will be repossessed, torn down, and turned into a block of flats unless Arthur's grandfather returns to sign some papers and pay off the family debt. Arthur discovers that the key to success lies in his own descent into the land of the Minimoys, creatures no larger than a tooth, whom his grandfather helped relocate to their garden. Somewhere among them is hidden a pile of rubies, too. Can Arthur be of stout heart and save the day? Romance beckons as well, and a villain lurks.

crew: Michael Winterbottom, Benedict Wong, Samantha Morton, Tim Robbins, Essie Davis, Nina Sosanya, Archie Panjabi, Om Puri, Natalie Mendoza, Nabil Elouahabi, Jeanne Balibar
overview: In a dystopian future, insurance fraud investigator William Gold arrives in Shanghai to investigate a forgery ring for "papelles", futuristic passports that record people's identities and genetics. Gold falls for Maria Gonzalez, the woman in charge of the forgeries. After a passionate affair, Gold returns home, having named a coworker as the culprit. But when one of Gonzalez's customers is found dead, Gold is sent back to Shanghai to complete the investigation.

crew: Pen-Ek Ratanaruang, Tadanobu Asano, Yutaka Matsushige, Sakichi Sato, Riki Takeuchi, Yoji Tanaka, Chermarn Boonyasak, Takashi Miike, Junko Nakazawa, Sinitta Boonyasak, Ampon Rattanawong
overview: An obsessive-compulsive Japanese librarian living in Bangkok spends most of his days contemplating suicide in his apartment. His life changes when he witnesses the death of a young girl and becomes acquainted with her elder sister.

crew: C. Jay Cox, Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Jacqueline Bisset, Erik Palladino, Mary Kay Place, Rob McElhenney, Khary Payton, Steve Sandvoss, Amber Benson, Wes Ramsey, Jim Ortlieb
overview: Christian, a hunky, 20-something, West Hollywood party boy gets more than he bargains for when he tries to seduce 19-year-old Elder Aaron Davis, a sexually confused Mormon missionary who moves into his apartment complex.

crew: Nuri Bilge Ceylan, Ercan Kesal, Nazan Kesal, Zuhal Gencer, Muzaffer Özdemir, Mehmet Emin Toprak, Ebru Ceylan, Arif Aşçı, Feridun Koç, Fatma Ceylan, Ayhan Ergürsel
overview: Uzak/Distant chronicles the numbing loneliness, longing, and isolation in the lives of two men who are consumed by their own problems. Istanbul photographer Mahmut reluctantly receives his relative Yusuf, but the mingling of their lives does little to alleviate their detachment.

originalTitle: Sky Captain and the World of Tomorrow
crew: Kerry Conran, Angelina Jolie, Giovanni Ribisi, Jude Law, Gwyneth Paltrow, Michael Gambon, Bai Ling, Laurence Olivier, Julian Curry, Omid Djalili, Mido Hamada
overview: When gigantic robots attack New York City, "Sky Captain" uses his private air force to fight them off. His ex-girlfriend, reporter Polly Perkins, has been investigating the recent disappearance of prominent scientists. Suspecting a link between the global robot attacks and missing men, Sky Captain and Polly decide to work together. They fly to the Himalayas in pursuit of the mysterious Dr. Totenkopf, the mastermind behind the robots.

crew: Ketan Mehta, Aamir Khan, Rani Mukerji, Toby Stephens, Ameesha Patel, Kirron Kher, Om Puri
overview: The film begins in 1857, when India was ruled by the British East India Company. Mangal Pandey is a sepoy, a soldier of Indian origin, in the army of the East India Company. Pandey is fighting in the Anglo-Afghan Wars and saves the life of his British commanding officer, William Gordon. Gordon is indebted to Pandey and a strong friendship develops between them, transcending both rank and race.

crew: Oliver Stone, Angelina Jolie, Anthony Hopkins, Colin Farrell, Val Kilmer, Jonathan Rhys Meyers, Jared Leto, Rosario Dawson, Rory McCann, Christopher Plummer, Joseph Morgan
overview: Alexander, the King of Macedonia, leads his legions against the giant Persian Empire. After defeating the Persians, he leads his army across the then known world, venturing farther than any westerner had ever gone, all the way to India.

crew: Ben Ramsey, Michael Jai White, Gina Carano, Julian Sands, Eamonn Walker, Francis Capra, Dante Basco, Sala Baker, Ron Yuan, Bob Sapp, Nona Gaye
overview: In Los Angeles, an ex-con takes the underground fighting world by storm in his quest to fulfill a promise to a dead friend.

crew: Aziz Mirza, Shah Rukh Khan, Rani Mukerji, Johny Lever, Lillete Dubey, Satish Shah, Jayshree Talpade, Jameel Khan, Meghna Malik, Bobby Darling, Jas Arora
overview: A man pursues a woman who is already engaged and eventually gets married to her. Differences between the two lead to a bitter separation that threatens to destroy their relationship forever.

crew: Fatih Akin, Mehmet Kurtuluş, Adam Bousdoukos, Meltem Cumbul, İdil Üner, Catrin Striebeck, Sibel Kekilli, Ralph Misske, Güven Kıraç, Cem Akin, Tim Seyfi
overview: With the intention to break free from the strict familial restrictions, a suicidal young woman sets up a marriage of convenience with a forty-year-old addict, an act that will lead to an outburst of envious love.

crew: Hayao Miyazaki, Akio Otsuka, Ryunosuke Kamiki, Takuya Kimura, Hiroyuki Morisaki, Chieko Baisho, Rio Kanno, Akihiro Miwa, Tomoe Hanba, Makoto Yasumura, Shigeyuki Totsugi
overview: Sophie, a young milliner, is turned into an elderly woman by a witch who enters her shop and curses her. She encounters a wizard named Howl and gets caught up in his resistance to fighting for the king.

crew: Mamoru Oshii, Mizuho Nishikubo, Naoko Kusumi, Akio Otsuka, Koichi Yamadera, Atsuko Tanaka, Masaki Terasoma, Hiroaki Hirata, Naoto Takenaka, Tamio Ohki, Fumihiko Tachiki, Yoshiko Sakakibara, Akeno Watanabe
overview: Cyborg detective Batou is assigned to investigate a series of murders committed by gynoids—doll-like cyborgs, which all malfunctioned, killed, then self-destructed afterwards. The brains of the gynoids initialize in order to protect their manufacturer's software, but in one gynoid, which Batou himself neutralized, one file remains: a voice speaking the phrase "Help me."

crew: Nikkhil Advani, Shah Rukh Khan, Preity Zinta, Kajol, Saif Ali Khan, Rani Mukerji, Rajpal Yadav, Reema Lagoo, Sonali Bendre, Sonali Bendre, Lillete Dubey

Luckily, these employees have effective revenge tactics.

The couple separate, and Marion begins an affair with Eddie, while Ted has a dalliance with his neighbor Evelyn.

But even as buried anger and accusations resurface, the way is opened for unexpected connection, adventure and forgiveness.

How can he find a way to do what is best for those he loves?

When the healer of the Clean Hairs tribe surprisingly kills two cavemen of his tribe, their imbecile chief assigns Pierre with curled hair and Pierre blonde to investigate the murder and find the criminal.

Together with Abigail and Hannibal, two deftly trained Nightstalkers, Blade follows a trail of blood to the ancient creature that is also hunting him—the original vampire, Dracula.

Her father agrees to recall the agents but secretly assigns James, an undercover agent, to pose as a student. They fall in love, but their romance is jeopardized when Samantha learns James' true identity.

While looking, he finds a mysterious isolated hotel where he decides to take a rest. Not only are the front desk clerks a bit strange, but even the ambiance feels unusual. Minami soon realizes he may have gotten more than he bargained for.

crew: Sean McNamara, Rebecca De Mornay, John Corbett, Hilary Duff, Rita Wilson, T.J. Thyne, Kat Dennings, David Keith, Jason Ritter, James Avery, Johnny Lewis

But what she learns only adds to her confusion, and her plans begin to unravel when she befriends one of the women.

While quarantined in the transit lounge until authorities can figure out what to do with him, Viktor simply goes on living – and courts romance with a beautiful flight attendant.

In addition to his regular team, he is joined on his boat by Ned, a man who believes Zissou to be his father, and Jane, a journalist pregnant by a married man. They travel the sea, all too often running into pirates and, perhaps more traumatically, various figures from Zissou's past, including his estranged wife, Eleanor.

crew: Richard Kelly, Cameron Diaz, James Marsden, Frank Langella, Gillian Jacobs, Holmes Osborne, Celia Weston, James Rebhorn, William Conrad, John Magaro, Jenna Lamia
overview: Norma and Arthur Lewis, a suburban couple with a young child, receive a simple wooden box as a gift, which bears fatal and irrevocable consequences. A mysterious stranger delivers the message that the box promises to bestow upon its owner $1 million with the press of a button. However pressing this button will simultaneously cause the death of another human being somewhere in the world; someone they don't know. With just 24 hours to have the box in their possession, Norma and Arthur find themselves in the cross-hairs of a startling moral dilemma and must face the true nature of their humanity.

crew: Mitch Rouse, Steve Zahn, Matt Dillon, Peter Jason, Christina Applegate, Noel Gugliemi, Fiona Gubelmann, Jenna Fischer, Dave Foley, Paul Dooley, Diana Maria Riva
overview: "Employee of the Month" is about a guy whose day spirals from bad to worse when he gets fired from his dream job at the bank and is dumped by his fiancée Sara. David's best friend Jack tries to convince him it's for the best, but the opposite occurs when bank robberies and millions of dollars become part of his day from hell.

crew: Oliver Hirschbiegel, Alexandra Maria Lara, Thomas Kretschmann, Elizaveta Boyarskaya, Justus von Dohnányi, Rolf Kanies, Birgit Minichmayr, Juliane Köhler, Bruno Ganz, Julia Jentsch, Götz Otto
overview: In April of 1945, Germany stands at the brink of defeat with the Russian Army closing in from the east and the Allied Expeditionary Force attacking from the west. In Berlin, capital of the Third Reich, Adolf Hitler proclaims that Germany will still achieve victory and orders his generals and advisers to fight to the last man. When the end finally does come, and Hitler lies dead by his own hand, what is left of his military must find a way to end the killing that is the Battle of Berlin, and lay down their arms in surrender.

crew: Takeshi Kitano, Tadanobu Asano, Akira Emoto, Kanji Tsuda, Yoji Tanaka, Takeshi Kitano, Ittoku Kishibe, Michiyo Yasuda, Yui Natsukawa, Yoshiyuki Morishita, Taichi Saotome
overview: Blind traveler Zatoichi is a master swordsman and a masseur with a fondness for gambling on dice games. When he arrives in a village torn apart by warring gangs, he sets out to protect the townspeople.

crew: Kevin Spacey, Greta Scacchi, Kate Bosworth, Brenda Blethyn, John Goodman, Bob Hoskins, Michael Byrne, Kevin Spacey, Caroline Aaron, Mehmet Yilmaz, Gary Whelan
overview: Based on the life and career of legendary entertainer, Bobby Darin, the biopic moves back and forth between his childhood and adulthood, to tell the tale of his life.

crew: Zack Snyder, Jake Weber, Ioan Gruffudd, Ving Rhames, Lindy Booth, Kevin Zegers, Michael Kelly, Sarah Polley, Mekhi Phifer, Matt Frewer, Zack Snyder
overview: A group of survivors take refuge in a shopping mall after the world is taken over by aggressive, flesh-eating zombies.

originalTitle: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
crew: Andrew Adamson, Liam Neeson, James McAvoy, Anna Popplewell, Ray Winstone, Tilda Swinton, Skandar Keynes, William Moseley, Jim Broadbent, Michael Madsen, Kiran Shah

There, they discover a charming, once peaceful kingdom that has been plunged into eternal winter by the evil White Witch, Jadis. Aided by the wise and magnificent lion, Aslan, the children lead Narnia into a spectacular, climactic battle to be free of the Witch's glacial powers forever.

crew: Derick Martini, Emma Roberts, Alec Baldwin, Timothy Hutton, Rory Culkin, Jill Hennessy, Cynthia Nixon, Kieran Culkin, Logan Huffman, Adam Scarimbolo, Brandon Thane Wilson

Scott, 15, is at the point in his life when he finds out that the most important people around him, his father, his mother, and his brother, are not exactly who he thought they were. They are flawed and they are human.

crew: David Koepp, Johnny Depp, Maria Bello, Timothy Hutton, John Turturro, Charles S. Dutton, Len Cariou, John Dunn-Hill, Vlasta Vrana, Sarah Allen, Bronwen Mantel
overview: Mort Rainey, a writer just emerging from a painful divorce with his ex-wife, is stalked at his remote lake house by a psychotic stranger and would-be scribe who claims Rainey swiped his best story idea. But as Rainey endeavors to prove his innocence, he begins to question his own sanity.

crew: D. J. Caruso, Angelina Jolie, Ethan Hawke, Kiefer Sutherland, Paul Dano, Marie-Josée Croze, Gena Rowlands, Jean-Hugues Anglade, Justin Chatwin, Tchéky Karyo, Shawn Roberts
