Her most promising lead is a museum employee who might be the killer's only eyewitness.

crew: Omar Naim, Robin Williams, Jim Caviezel, Mira Sorvino, Blu Mankuma, Brendan Fletcher, Wanda Cannon, Darren Shahlavi, Sarah Deakins, Mimi Kuzyk, Stefan Arngrim

While they often act out to relieve one another's pain, their game might be a way to avoid the fact that they are truly meant for one another.

crew: Park Chan-wook, Yoo Yeon-seok, Choi Min-sik, Kim Byeong-ok, Yoon Jin-seo, Kang Hye-jung, Lee Dae-yeon, Ji Dae-han, Yoo Ji-tae, Oh Dal-su, Oh Tae-kyung

crew: Rawson Marshall Thurber, Jason Bateman, Chuck Norris, David Hasselhoff, Ben Stiller, Gary Cole, Curtis Armstrong, Alan Tudyk, Missi Pyle, Vince Vaughn, Hank Azaria

Aided by a dodgeball guru and Goodman's attorney, La Fleur and his rag-tag team of underdogs launch a knock-down, drag-out battle in which the winner takes all.

crew: Steven Brill, Antony Starr, Seth Green, Matthew Lillard, Burt Reynolds, Rachel Blanchard, Scott Adsit, Gregory Cruz, Christina Moore, Ethan Suplee, Ray Baker

When looking through their childhood belongings, they discover a trunk which contained details on a quest their friend was attempting. It revealed that he was hot on the trail of the $200,000 that went missing with airplane hijacker D.B. Cooper in 1971. They decide to continue his journey, but do not understand the dangers they will soon encounter.

crew: Terry Zwigoff, Steve Buscemi, John Malkovich, Lauren Lee Smith, Jim Broadbent, Anjelica Huston, Scoot McNairy, Brian Geraghty, Sophia Myles, Adam Scott, Katherine Moennig

He tries to find someone to blame for his misfortunes and comes up with the President of the United States who he plans to murder.

crew: Mathieu Kassovitz, Vin Diesel, Gérard Depardieu, Mark Strong, Michelle Yeoh, Charlotte Rampling, Mélanie Thierry, Lambert Wilson, David Belle, Jérôme Le Banner, Jan Unger

crew: Grant Harvey, Katharine Isabelle, JR Bourne, David La Haye, Emily Perkins, Hugh Dillon, Brendan Fletcher, Nathaniel Arcand, Adrien Dorval, Tom McCamus, Matthew Walker
overview: Set in 19th Century Canada, Brigette and her sister Ginger take refuge in a Traders' Fort which later becomes under siege by some savage werewolves. And an enigmatic Indian hunter decides to help the girls, but one of the girls has been bitten by a werewolf. Brigitte and Ginger may have no one to turn to but themselves.

crew: Kim Jee-woon, Lim Soo-jung, Kim Kap-soo, Lee Dae-yeon, Yum Jung-ah, Moon Geun-young, Park Mi-hyun, Woo Ki-hong, Lee Seung-bi

crew: Richard Shepard, Hope Davis, Pierce Brosnan, Greg Kinnear, Adam Scott, Dylan Baker, Portia Dawson, Philip Baker Hall, Roberto Sosa, Guillermo Capetillo, Gabriela Goldsmith

Their meeting sets off a chain of events that will change their lives forever, as Wright is suddenly thrust into a far-from-mundane existence that he takes to surprisingly well … once he gets acclimated to it.

crew: Nikolai Müllerschön, Lena Headey, Til Schweiger, Joseph Fiennes, Matthias Schweighöfer, Maxim Mehmet, Axel Prahl, Julie Engelbrecht, Hanno Koffler, Ralph Misske, Jan Unger

Marked by sportsmanlike conduct, technical exactitude and knightly propriety, they have their own code of honour. Before long he begins to understand that his hero status is deceptive. His love for Kate, a nurse, opens his eyes to the brutality of war.

crew: Guy Ritchie, Jason Statham, Mark Strong, Ray Liotta, Terence Maynard, André 3000, Ian Puleston-Davies, Francesca Annis, Tom Wu, Vincent Pastore, Andrew Howard

Rarely is he allowed in any casino because he's a bona fide winner and, in fact, has taken so much money over the years that he's the sole client of his accountant elder brother, Billy. Invited to a private game, Jake is in fear of losing his life.

crew: Stephen Gaghan, Matt Damon, George Clooney, Mark Strong, Amanda Peet, Jeffrey Wright, Tim Blake Nelson, Alexander Siddig, Christopher Plummer, Chris Cooper, Kayvan Novak

Meanwhile, veteran CIA agent Bob Barnes uncovers an assassination plot with unsettling origins.

crew: Edgar Wright, Bill Nighy, Martin Freeman, Simon Pegg, Rafe Spall, Julia Davis, Mark Gatiss, Nick Frost, Paul Kaye, Chris Martin, Matt Lucas

crew: Liam Lynch, Jack Black, Amy Adams, Ben Stiller, Colin Hanks, Amy Poehler, John C. Reilly, Tim Robbins, Fred Armisen, Meat Loaf, Andrew Lewis Caldwell

As the two grow closer, and her daughters increasingly rely on Denny, Terry starts to have reservations about where their relationship is headed.

The couple has an illegitimate child, and Jeanne's bigoted parents send the baby to a faraway convent to be raised by nuns.

Becoming attracted to her, he tries to get nearer, and goes to her shop to buy something, but finds out that he can't afford it. So he puts the photocopier to other uses, and begins to envisage fishy schemes to earn some money.

Indy is coerced to head to Peru at the behest of a young man whose friend—and Indy's colleague—Professor Oxley has been captured for his knowledge of the skull's whereabouts.

crew: Takashi Shimizu, Takashi Matsuyama, Chiharu Niiyama, Yui Ichikawa, Noriko Sakai, Hidekazu Mashima, Kaoru Mizuki, Kei Horie, Ayumu Saito, Satoru Jitsunashi, Yasuhi Nakamura

crew: Jonathan Demme, Denzel Washington, Ted Levine, Vera Farmiga, Meryl Streep, Anthony Mackie, Jon Voight, Jeffrey Wright, Liev Schreiber, Pablo Schreiber, Miguel Ferrer

He begins to doubt that his fellow squad-mate Sergeant Raymond Shaw, now a vice-presidential candidate, is the hero he remembers him being. As Marco's doubts deepen, Shaw's political power grows, and, when Marco finds a mysterious implant embedded in his back, the memory of what really happened begins to return.

crew: John Turturro, Kate Winslet, Steve Buscemi, Christopher Walken, Mary-Louise Parker, Tony Goldwyn, Susan Sarandon, Bobby Cannavale, John Turturro, James Gandolfini, Mandy Moore
overview: Ironworker Nick lives with his wife, Kitty, and three daughters. When he meets a significantly younger woman, Tula, he starts an affair with her, much to the chagrin of his wife, and his life is thrown into upheaval. Kitty kicks Nick out of the house, and he is forced to make some difficult decisions.

crew: M. Night Shyamalan, Sigourney Weaver, Jesse Eisenberg, Joaquin Phoenix, Adrien Brody, Bryce Dallas Howard, Judy Greer, Michael Pitt, Brendan Gleeson, M. Night Shyamalan, Jayne Atkinson
overview: When a willful young man tries to venture beyond his sequestered Pennsylvania hamlet, his actions set off a chain of chilling incidents that will alter the community forever.

crew: Richard Eyre, Alice Eve, Billy Crudup, Claire Danes, Edward Fox, Hugh Bonneville, Rupert Everett, Tom Hollander, Tom Wilkinson, Stephen Marcus, Clare Higgins

And because this is the 17th century, Maria, like other females, is prohibited from pursuing her dream of acting. But when powerful people support her, King Charles II lifts the ban on female stage performers. And just as Maria aided Ned, she needs his help to learn her new profession.

crew: Cameron Crowe, Jessica Biel, Bruce McGill, Kirsten Dunst, Alec Baldwin, Orlando Bloom, Susan Sarandon, Judy Greer, Allison Munn, Jed Rees, Gailard Sartain
overview: Drew Baylor is fired after causing his shoe company to lose hundreds of millions of dollars. To make matters worse, he's also dumped by his girlfriend. On the verge of ending it all, Drew gets a new lease on life when he returns to his family's small Kentucky hometown after his father dies. Along the way, he meets a flight attendant with whom he falls in love.

crew: Todd Haynes, Richard Gere, Ben Whishaw, Julianne Moore, Christian Bale, Michelle Williams, Cate Blanchett, Heath Ledger, Bruce Greenwood, Charlotte Gainsbourg, Kris Kristofferson
overview: Six actors portray six personas of music legend Bob Dylan in scenes depicting various stages of his life, chronicling his rise from unknown folksinger to international icon and revealing how Dylan constantly reinvented himself.

The chest's whereabouts may lie in secret clues embedded in the Constitution and the Declaration of Independence, and Gates is in a race to find the gold before his enemies do.

crew: Prachya Pinkaew, Tony Jaa, Petchtai Wongkamlao, Dan Chupong, Suchao Pongwilai, Wannakit Sirioput, Cheathavuth Watcharakhun, Patrarin Punyanutatam, Pumwaree Yodkamol, Rungrawee Barijindakul, Choomporn Theppitak

overview: Mia Thermopolis is now a college graduate and on her way to Genovia to take up her duties as princess. Her best friend Lilly also joins her for the summer. Mia continues her 'princess lessons'- riding horses side-saddle, archery, and other royal. But her complicated life is turned upside down once again when she not only learns that she is to take the crown as queen earlier than expected...

crew: Alan Mak, Andrew Lau Wai-Keung, Kara Wai Ying-Hung, Edison Chen, Anthony Wong Chau-Sang, Eric Tsang, Carina Lau, Hu Jun, Francis Ng, Liu Kai-Chi, William Duen Wai-Lun, Shawn Yue

Two intelligent people, Dick and Jane actually get pretty good at robbing people and even enjoy it -- but they have second thoughts when they're reminded that crime can hurt innocent people. When the couple hears that Globodyne boss Jack McCallister actually swindled the company, they plot revenge.

crew: Colin Trevorrow, Vincent D'Onofrio, Chris Pratt, Bryce Dallas Howard, Judy Greer, Ty Simpkins, Katie McGrath, Lauren Lapkus, Jake Johnson, BD Wong, Brian Tee

But there's a problem standing in the way of everlasting bliss: Kevin's overbearing and controlling mother, Viola. Fearing she'll lose her son's affections forever, Viola decides to break up the happy couple by becoming the world's worst mother-in-law.

Cultures clash and tensions run high as Flor and the Claskys struggle to share space while raising their children on their own, and very different, terms.

As reality starts to contradict fact, Sam spirals into an unstable mental state. Then he finds a clue as to how and when Henry may try to kill himself, and races to try to stop him.

originalTitle: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
crew: Garth Jennings, Bill Nighy, Helen Mirren, Martin Freeman, John Malkovich, Alan Rickman, Zooey Deschanel, Sam Rockwell, Thomas Lennon, Kelly Macdonald, Ian McNeice

crew: Priyadarshan, Rajpal Yadav, Shakti Kapoor, Aftab Shivdasani, Rimi Sen, Akshaye Khanna, Shweta Menon, Jagadish, Paresh Rawal, Tiku Talsania, Shoma Anand

Aftab and Rimi play two strangers who have to pretend that are a married couple in order to get a place to live. Paresh Rawal plays a rich, yet ground to earth businessman whose business is named after his wife Anjali. Akshaye Khanna plays a young man starting a new business in electronic ware. Things get complicated when Rimi Sen goes to Paresh Rawal's house in search of a job & meets Akshaye Khanna who falls in love with her thinking she is Paresh Rawal's daughter. Paresh Rawal's wife thinks that he is having an affair with Rimi Sen while Paresh Rawal thinks his wife is having an affair with Akshaye. Enter Shakti Kapoor whose daughter falls in love with a guy pretending to be Paresh Rawal's son and soon everything gets out of control.

The pair run for their lives and Bourne, who promised retaliation should anyone from his former life attempt contact, is forced to once again take up his life as a trained assassin to survive.

Determined to show everyone -- most of all Jeffrey -- that her romantic life is as full and thrilling as ever, Kat hires a charming male escort as her date.

When he has to murder a 12-year old call-girl, he refuses and becomes a target himself. While Vincke and Verstuyft are chasing him and counting the corpses, Ledda is taking care of his employers.

Joe has planned a postcard-perfect afternoon in the English countryside with his partner, Claire.  But as Joe and Claire prepare to open a bottle of champagne, their idyll comes to an abrupt end.  A hot air balloon drifts into the field, obviously in trouble.  The pilot catches his leg in the anchor rope, while the only passenger, a boy, is too scared to jump down.  Joe and three other men rush to secure the basket.  But fate has other ideas...

Adopting the rum-soaked lifestyle of the late ‘50s version of Hemingway’s 'The Lost Generation', Paul soon becomes entangled with a very attractive American woman and her fiancée, a businessman involved in shady property development deals.  It is within this world that Kemp ultimately discovers his true voice as a writer and integrity as a man.

Crash-landing in a remote uncharted part of the desert, the two pilots and their passengers -- a crew of oil workers and a drifter -- must work together to survive by rebuilding the aircraft. Soon, low supplies and a band of merciless smugglers add even greater urgency to their task.

crew: Charles Dance, Daniel Brühl, Natascha McElhone, Toby Jones, Judi Dench, Maggie Smith, David Warner, Miriam Margolyes, Clive Russell, Freddie Jones, Alan Cox
overview: Andrea, a gifted young Polish violinist from Krakow, is bound for America when he is swept overboard by a storm. When the Widdington sisters discover the handsome stranger on the beach below their house, they nurse him back to health. However, the presence of the musically talented young man disrupts the peaceful lives of Ursula and Janet and the community in which they live.

crew: Shona Auerbach, Gerard Butler, Emily Mortimer, Sharon Small, Katy Murphy, Cal MacAninch, Andrea Gibb, Anne Marie Timoney, Mary Riggans, Rony Bridges, Jayd Johnson
overview: Nine-year-old Frankie and his single mum Lizzie have been on the move ever since Frankie can remember, most recently arriving in a seaside Scottish town. Wanting to protect her deaf son from the truth that they've run away from his father, Lizzie has invented a story that he is away at sea on the HMS Accra. Every few weeks, Lizzie writes Frankie a make-believe letter from his father, telling of his adventures in exotic lands. As Frankie tracks the ship's progress around the globe, he discovers that it is due to dock in his hometown. With the real HMS Accra arriving in only a fortnight, Lizzie must choose between telling Frankie the truth or finding the perfect stranger to play Frankie's father for just one day...

Their efforts constantly find the 'Duke Boys' eluding authorities in 'The General Lee', their 1969 orange Dodge Charger that keeps them one step ahead of the dimwitted antics of the small southern town's Sheriff, Roscoe P. Coltrane.

crew: Kunal Kohli, Saif Ali Khan, Rani Mukerji, Rishi Kapoor, Jimmy Shergill, Kirron Kher, Isha Koppikar, Abhishek Bachchan, Rati Agnihotri, Shenaz Treasury, Parinita Seth

crew: John Stockwell, Jessica Alba, Paul Walker, Josh Brolin, Scott Caan, Ashley Scott, James Frain, Tyson Beckford, Dwayne Adway, Chris Taloa, Gill Montie
overview: When they take some friends on an extreme sport adventure, the last thing Jared and Sam expect to see below the shark-infested waters is a legendary pirate ship rumored to contain millions of dollars in gold. But their good fortune is short-lived, as a ruthless gang of criminals gets word of what they have uncovered.

crew: Quentin Tarantino, Uma Thurman, Samuel L. Jackson, Lucy Liu, Daryl Hannah, Vivica A. Fox, Gordon Liu Chia-hui, Michael Madsen, Kazuki Kitamura, David Carradine, Chiaki Kuriyama
overview: The Bride unwaveringly continues on her roaring rampage of revenge against the band of assassins who had tried to kill her and her unborn child. She visits each of her former associates one-by-one, checking off the victims on her Death List Five until there's nothing left to do … but kill Bill.

crew: Andrés Wood, Tiago Correa, Federico Luppi, Aline Küppenheim, Alejandro Trejo, Francisca Imboden, Andrea García-Huidobro, Tamara Acosta, Francisco Reyes, Juan Pablo Miranda, Alejandro Goic

Father McEnroe supports his leftist views by introducing a program at the prestigious "collegio" (Catholic prep school) St. Patrick to allow free admission of some proletarian kids. One of them is Pedro Machuca, slum-raised son of the cleaning lady in Gonzalo Infante's liberal-bourgeois home. Yet the new classmates become buddies, paradoxically protesting together as Gonzalo gets adopted by Pedro's slum family and gang. But the adults spoil that too, not in the least when general Pinochet's coup ousts Allende, and supporters such as McEnroe.

crew: Tasos Boulmetis, Başak Köklükaya, Gökçe Akyıldız, Mihalis Giannatos, Georges Corraface, Stelios Mainas, Ieroklis Michaelidis, Tamer Karadağlı, Pavlos Orkopoulos, Themis Panou, Renia Louizidou
overview: "A Touch of Spice" is a story about Fanis, a young Greek boy growing up in Istanbul, whose grandfather, a culinary philosopher and mentor, teaches him that both food and life require a little salt to give them flavor. They both require... A Touch of Spice. Fanis grows up to become an excellent cook and uses his cooking skills to spice up the lives of those around him. 35 years later he leaves Athens and travels back to his birthplace of Istanbul to reunite with his grandfather and his first love. He travels back only to realize that he forgot to put a little bit of spice in his own life.

crew: Woody Allen, Steve Carell, Jonny Lee Miller, Will Ferrell, Radha Mitchell, Josh Brolin, Amanda Peet, Chiwetel Ejiofor, Wallace Shawn, Daniel Sunjata, Chloë Sevigny

To illustrate his point, he tells his guests two parallel stories about Melinda ; both versions have the same basic elements, but one take on her state of affairs leans toward levity, while the other is full of anguish. Each story involves Melinda coping with a recent divorce through substance abuse while beginning a romantic relationship with a close friend's husband.

crew: Jim Jarmusch, Steve Buscemi, Cate Blanchett, Bill Murray, Alfred Molina, RZA, Steve Coogan, Isaach De Bankolé, Roberto Benigni, Tom Waits, Alex Descas

crew: Vishal Bhardwaj, Tabu, Murali Sharma, Irrfan Khan, Shweta Menon, Om Puri, Naseeruddin Shah, Pankaj Kapur, Dibyendu Bhattacharya, Ankur Vikal, Ajay Gehi

But... the greatest danger of all may be on their ship.

As Barbara tries to "cure" Antony of his sexuality -- sometimes by seducing him herself -- the groundwork is laid for a murderous tragedy.

The lives of some of these characters cross with others along the night.

Phil steps in to be the temporary coach and immediately begins to butt heads with this dad over this new competition in their lives.

They arrive in Vizontele, just as the situation is becoming really absurd. Guner brings wisdom; his daughter Tuba brings beauty, innocence and love. Some like the Mayor, Nazmi Dogan and crazy Emin appreciate these things but they are in the minority and confusion continues to reign. The story is based on the memories of writer-director Yılmaz Erdoğan of the last summer of his childhood in Hakkâri, Turkey in 1980.

crew: Olivier Assayas, Frédéric Auburtin, Gurinder Chadha, Sylvain Chomet, Isabel Coixet, Wes Craven, Alfonso Cuarón, Gérard Depardieu, Christopher Doyle, Richard LaGravenese, Vincenzo Natali, Alexander Payne, Walter Salles, Oliver Schmitz, Nobuhiro Suwa, Daniela Thomas, Tom Tykwer, Gus Van Sant, Ethan Coen, Joel Coen, Bruno Podalydès, Willem Dafoe, Natalie Portman, Steve Buscemi, Olga Kurylenko, Elijah Wood, Maggie Gyllenhaal, Catalina Sandino Moreno, Gérard Depardieu, Ludivine Sagnier, Nick Nolte
overview: Olivier Assayas, Gus Van Sant, Wes Craven and Alfonso Cuaron are among the 20 distinguished directors who contribute to this collection of 18 stories, each exploring a different aspect of Parisian life. The colourful characters in this drama include a pair of mimes, a husband trying to chose between his wife and his lover, and a married man who turns to a prostitute for advice.

crew: Andrew Stanton, Polly Walker, Willem Dafoe, Bryan Cranston, Mark Strong, Lynn Collins, James Purefoy, Ciarán Hinds, Jon Favreau, Samantha Morton, Taylor Kitsch
overview: John Carter is a war-weary, former military captain who's inexplicably transported to the mysterious and exotic planet of Barsoom (Mars) and reluctantly becomes embroiled in an epic conflict. It's a world on the brink of collapse, and Carter rediscovers his humanity when he realizes the survival of Barsoom and its people rests in his hands.

crew: Robert Rodriguez, Frank Miller, Quentin Tarantino, Jessica Alba, Carla Gugino, Bruce Willis, Alexis Bledel, Elijah Wood, Benicio del Toro, Brittany Murphy, Josh Hartnett, Mickey Rourke, Rutger Hauer

Then there are those who call it home — Crooked cops, sexy dames, desperate vigilantes. Some are seeking revenge, others lust after redemption, and then there are those hoping for a little of both. A universe of unlikely and reluctant heroes still trying to do the right thing in a city that refuses to care.

crew: Jeremy Haft, Jenna Dewan, Matthew Marsden, Jeffrey Reddick, Claudette Mink, Chad Faust, Melissa Marie Elias, Marc Devigne, Ernesto Griffith, Chris Sigurdson, Gil Hacohen

crew: Billy Ray, Ryan Phillippe, Gary Cole, Laura Linney, Dennis Haysbert, Kathleen Quinlan, Chris Cooper, Caroline Dhavernas, Bruce Davison, Jonathan Potts, Scott Gibson

O'Neill's told it's an investigation of Hanssen's sexual habits, however Hanssen is really suspected of spying for the Soviet Union and Russia for years and being responsible for the deaths of agents working for the United States.

Together, they infiltrate in the Turkish mafia trying to find the answer to the crimes. Meanwhile, the worker Anna Heymes is being submitted to a brain treatment and has severe headaches and glimpses of memories and visions. When these two parallel events collide, disclose that the Turkish organization "The Wolves" is behind them.

crew: Terrence Malick, Colin Farrell, Christian Bale, Eddie Marsan, Q'orianka Kilcher, David Thewlis, Christopher Plummer, Jonathan Pryce, Ben Mendelsohn, Kirk Acevedo, Raoul Max Trujillo

overview: To remedy his financial problems, a travel agent has his eye on a frozen corpse, which just happens to be sought after by two hitmen.

crew: Tony Giglio, Jason Statham, Ryan Phillippe, Wesley Snipes, Jessica Steen, Keegan Connor Tracy, Nicholas Lea, Ty Olsson, Rob LaBelle, Justine Waddell, Terry Chen

During a bank heist with a hostage situation, Conners is assigned in charge of the operation with the rookie Shane Dekker as his partner. The thieves, lead by Lorenz, apparently do not steal a penny from the bank. While chasing the gangsters, the police team disclose that they planted a virus in the system, stealing one billion dollars from the different accounts, using the principle of the Chaos Theory. Further, they find that Lorenz is killing his accomplices.

crew: Gus Van Sant, Michael Pitt, Lukas Haas, Asia Argento, Gus Van Sant, Ricky Jay, Harmony Korine, Nicole Vicius, Kim Gordon, Kurt Loder, Scott Patrick Green

They are divided up into the forces of light and the forces of the dark, who signed a truce several centuries ago to end a devastating battle. Ever since, the forces of light govern the day while the night belongs to their dark opponents. In modern day Moscow the dark Others actually roam the night as vampires while a "Night Watch" of light forces, among them Anton, the movie's protagonist, try to control them and limit their outrage

originalTitle: The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants

When a pretty neighbor named Sheeni plays records by French crooners, it's love at first sight for frustrated and inexperienced Nick. Learning that she is dating someone, Nick launches a hilarious quest to find his way into Sheeni's heart -- and bed.

Inspired by the freedom fighters they represent in the film, the friends collectively decide to avenge the killing.

Professor Azuma's "neo-cell" project, which is supposed to be the answer to mankind's hardships, becomes a nightmare come true when mutants spawned from the experiment escape and declare war on the human race. Azuma's son Tetsuya, who was killed during the previous war, is reborn into the cyborg Casshern as mankind's last hope against the new mutant threat. This live-action sci-fi movie based on a 1973 Japanese animé of the same name.

With the help of an astronaut, the boys attempt to return home.

And everybody is on some form of drug just to get through their days.

Through unconventional team-building exercises and his offbeat coaching style, Buttermaker helps his hapless Bears prepare to meet their rivals, the Yankees.

Upbeat and passionate, Georgia charms everybody she meets, including renowned Chef Didier. The only one missing from her new life is her longtime crush Sean Matthews.

On the eve of Forster's execution, one of Gramm's students is murdered in a vicious copycat crime, and Gramm himself receives an ominous message informing him that he has less than 90 minutes to live.

overview: In the 1970s, a young transgender woman called “Kitten” leaves her small Irish town for London in search of love, acceptance, and her long-lost mother.

crew: John Fawcett, Maria Bello, Sean Bean, Maurice Roëves, Sophie Stuckey, Richard Elfyn, Abigail Stone, Eluned Jones, Robin Griffith, Casper Harvey, Gwenyth Petty
overview: In an attempt to pull her family together, Adèlle travels with her young daughter Sarah to Wales to visit her father. The morning after they arrive, Sarah mysteriously vanishes in the ocean. Not long after, a little girl bearing a striking resemblance to their missing daughter reveals that she has retuned from the dead  — and that Sarah has been taken to the Welsh underworld.

originalTitle: De battre mon coeur s'est arrêté
crew: Jacques Audiard, Mélanie Laurent, Romain Duris, Emmanuelle Devos, Aure Atika, Jonathan Zaccaï, Niels Arestrup, Gilles Cohen, Linh-Dan Pham, Justine Le Pottier, Vladislav Galard
overview: Like his father, Tom is a real estate agent who makes his money from dirty, and sometimes brutal, deals. But a chance encounter prompts him to take up the piano and become a concert pianist. He auditions with the help of a beautiful, young virtuoso pianist who cannot speak French - music is their only exchange. But pressures from the ugly world of his day job soon become more than he can handle.

crew: Jean-François Richet, Ludivine Sagnier, Vincent Cassel, Mathieu Amalric, Roy Dupuis, Samuel Le Bihan, Laure Marsac, Anne Consigny, Gérard Lanvin, Olivier Gourmet, Fanny Sidney
overview: The story of Jacques Mesrine, France's public enemy No. 1 during the 1970s. After nearly two decades of legendary criminal feats -- from multiple bank robberies and to prison breaks -- Mesrine was gunned down by the French police in Paris.

crew: Guillermo del Toro, Ron Perlman, Guillermo del Toro, John Hurt, Jeffrey Tambor, Selma Blair, Doug Jones, Seth MacFarlane, Luke Goss, Anna Walton, Jimmy Kimmel
overview: Hellboy, his pyrokinetic girlfriend, Liz, and aquatic empath, Abe Sapien, face their biggest battle when an underworld elven prince plans to reclaim Earth for his magical kindred. Tired of living in the shadow of humans, Prince Nuada tries to awaken an ancient force of killing machines, the all-powerful Golden Army, to clear the way for fantasy creatures to roam free. Only Hellboy can stop the dark prince and prevent humanity's annihilation.

crew: Jim Jarmusch, Tilda Swinton, Sharon Stone, Jeffrey Wright, Bill Murray, Jessica Lange, Chloë Sevigny, Mark Webber, Frances Conroy, Chris Bauer, Christopher McDonald
overview: As the devoutly single Don Johnston is dumped by his latest girlfriend, he receives an anonymous pink letter informing him that he has a son who may be looking for him.

crew: Roger Donaldson, Antony Starr, Anthony Hopkins, Walton Goggins, Bruce Greenwood, Diane Ladd, Craig Hall, Patrick John Flueger, William Lucking, Paul Rodríguez, Chris Williams
overview: The life story of New Zealander Burt Munro, who spent years building a 1920 Indian motorcycle—a bike which helped him set the land-speed world record at Utah's Bonneville Salt Flats in 1967.

crew: Julian Jarrold, Emma Thompson, Hayley Atwell, Ben Whishaw, Felicity Jones, Greta Scacchi, Matthew Goode, Michael Gambon, Tom Wlaschiha, Patrick Malahide, Ed Stoppard
overview: Based on Evelyn Waugh's 1945 classic British novel, Brideshead Revisited is a poignant story of forbidden love and the loss of innocence set in England prior to the Second World War.

crew: Craig Rosenberg, Demi Moore, Henry Ian Cusick, James Cosmo, Nicholas Gleaves, Therese Bradley, Jordan El-Balawi, Hans Matheson, Jamie Edgell, Joanna Hole, Kate Isitt
overview: Rachel Carson, a best-selling crime novelist, is devastated and filled with guilt over the accidental death of her son. Hoping that a change of scenery will help alleviate her suffering, she leaves her home in the city and moves into a vacant country house owned by a friend and begins a relationship with charming local Angus. But, just as her life is taking a turn for the better, Rachel realizes she's being romanced by a ghost, leading her to doubt her own sanity.

crew: Mark Levin, Josh Hutcherson, Willie Garson, Charlie Ray, Cynthia Nixon, Bradley Whitford, Jess Weixler, Josh Pais, Timothy Adams, Alex Trebek, Aaron Grady Shaw
overview: Ten-year-old Gabe was just a normal kid growing up in Manhattan until Rosemary Telesco walked into his life, actually into his karate class. But before Gabe can tell Rosemary how he feels, she tells him she will not be going to public school any more. Gabe has a lot more to learn about life, love, and girls.

crew: Stephen Frears, Kelly Reilly, Toby Jones, Bob Hoskins, Judi Dench, Natalia Tena, Michael Culkin, Christopher Guest, Richard Dormer, Anna Brewster, Ann Queensberry
overview: Eccentric 70-year-old widow purchases the Windmill Theatre in London as a post-widowhood hobby. After starting an innovative continuous variety review, which is copied by other theaters, they begin to lose money. Mrs. Henderson suggests they add female nudity similar to the Moulin Rouge in Paris.

crew: Tom Shadyac, Morgan Freeman, Rachael Harris, Steve Carell, Simon Helberg, Dean Norris, John Michael Higgins, John Goodman, Jonah Hill, Ed Helms, Catherine Bell
overview: Junior congressman Evan Baxter, whose wish is to "change the world" is heard by none other than God. When God appears with the perplexing request to build an ark, Evan is sure he is losing it.

crew: Chris Miller, Ian McShane, John Krasinski, Eddie Murphy, Antonio Banderas, Cameron Diaz, Julie Andrews, Maya Rudolph, Seth Rogen, John Cleese, Amy Poehler
overview: The King of Far Far Away has died and Shrek and Fiona are to become King & Queen. However, Shrek wants to return to his cozy swamp and live in peace and quiet, so when he finds out there is another heir to the throne, they set off to bring him back to rule the kingdom.

crew: Sam Raimi, Tobey Maguire, Willem Dafoe, Kirsten Dunst, James Franco, Elizabeth Banks, J.K. Simmons, James Cromwell, Bryce Dallas Howard, Bruce Campbell, Topher Grace
overview: The seemingly invincible Spider-Man goes up against an all-new crop of villains—including the shape-shifting Sandman. While Spider-Man’s superpowers are altered by an alien organism, his alter ego, Peter Parker, deals with nemesis Eddie Brock and also gets caught up in a love triangle.

crew: Gary Winick, Julia Roberts, Dakota Fanning, Kathy Bates, Steve Buscemi, Beau Bridges, John Cleese, Robert Redford, Cedric the Entertainer, Essie Davis, Siobhan Fallon Hogan
overview: Wilbur the pig is scared of the end of the season, because he knows that come that time, he will end up on the dinner table. He hatches a plan with Charlotte, a spider that lives in his pen, to ensure that this will never happen.

crew: Shekhar Kapur, Jonathan Bailey, Cate Blanchett, Sam Spruell, Eddie Redmayne, Rhys Ifans, Geoffrey Rush, Samantha Morton, Clive Owen, Abbie Cornish, Jordi Mollà
overview: When Queen Elizabeth's reign is threatened by ruthless familial betrayal and Spain's invading army, she and her shrewd adviser must act to safeguard the lives of her people.

crew: Joe Wright, Donald Sutherland, Kelly Reilly, Rosamund Pike, Keira Knightley, Carey Mulligan, Jena Malone, Brenda Blethyn, Talulah Riley, Matthew Macfadyen, Judi Dench
overview: A story of love and life among the landed English gentry during the Georgian era. Mr. Bennet is a gentleman living in Hertfordshire with his overbearing wife and five daughters, but if he dies their house will be inherited by a distant cousin whom they have never met, so the family's future happiness and security is dependent on the daughters making good marriages.

crew: Steve Oedekerk, Sam Elliott, Danny Glover, Andie MacDowell, Courteney Cox, David Koechner, John DiMaggio, Audrey Wasilewski, Laraine Newman, Khamani Griffin, Kevin James

crew: Jamie Babbit, Elisha Cuthbert, Camilla Belle, Shawn Ashmore, Edie Falco, Shannon Woodward, Martin Donovan, David Gallagher, Katy Mixon, Myrna Cabello, Ken Thomas

The Deers' daughter, Nina, is openly hostile to Dot, but that does not prevent her from telling her secrets to her silent stepsister, including the fact that she wants to kill her lecherous father.

crew: James Wong, Mary Elizabeth Winstead, Yan-Kay Crystal Lowe, Dustin Milligan, Amanda Crew, Gina Holden, Tony Todd, Ryan Merriman, Andrew Francis, Kris Lemche, Texas Battle
overview: A student's premonition of a deadly rollercoaster ride saves her life and a lucky few, but not from death itself – which seeks out those who escaped their fate.

crew: Darren Aronofsky, Rachel Weisz, Hugh Jackman, Cliff Curtis, Stephen McHattie, Mark Margolis, Ethan Suplee, Ellen Burstyn, Sean Patrick Thomas, Donna Murphy, Richard McMillan

originalTitle: Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby
crew: Adam McKay, Sacha Baron Cohen, Will Ferrell, Amy Adams, Gary Cole, John C. Reilly, Michael Clarke Duncan, David Koechner, Andy Richter, Jane Lynch, Jack McBrayer
overview: The fastest man on four wheels, Ricky Bobby is one of the greatest drivers in NASCAR history. A big, hairy American winning machine, Ricky has everything a dimwitted daredevil could want, a luxurious mansion, a smokin' hot wife and all the fast food he can eat. But Ricky's turbo-charged lifestyle hits an unexpected speed bump when he's bested by flamboyant Euro-idiot Jean Girard and reduced to a fear-ridden wreck.

crew: Menno Meyjes, Amanda Peet, Joan Cusack, John Cusack, Anjelica Huston, Oliver Platt, Richard Schiff, David James Lewis, Howard Hesseman, Sophie Okonedo, David Kaye
overview: A recently-widowed science fiction writer considers whether to adopt a hyper-imaginative 6-year-old abandoned and socially-rejected boy who says he's really from Mars.

crew: Sergei Bodrov, Tadanobu Asano, Amadu Mamadakov, Sun Honglei, Khulan Chuluun, Baasanjav Mijid, Li Jiaqi, Aliya, Bu Ren, Ben Hon Sun, He Qi

crew: Rod Lurie, Samuel L. Jackson, Josh Hartnett, Rachel Nichols, Alan Alda, Teri Hatcher, Peter Coyote, Harry Lennix, Kathryn Morris, Dakota Goyo, David Paymer

What begins as an opportunity to resurrect Champ's story and escape the shadow of his father's success becomes a personal journey as the ambitious reporter reexamines his own life and his relationship with his family.

To escape her lonely life and troubled relationship with her father, Lily flees with Rosaleen, her caregiver and only friend, to a South Carolina town that holds the secret to her mother's past.

crew: Mark Waters, Freddie Highmore, Mary-Louise Parker, Seth Rogen, Ron Perlman, Nick Nolte, Martin Short, Andrew McCarthy, David Strathairn, Sarah Bolger, Joan Plowright

crew: Greg McLean, Teresa Palmer, Andy McPhee, Kestie Morassi, Nathan Phillips, Cassandra Magrath, John Jarratt, Paul Curran, Gordon Poole, Aaron J. March, Michael Moody
overview: Stranded backpackers in remote Australia fall prey to a murderous bushman, who offers to fix their car, then takes them captive.

crew: Woody Allen, Scarlett Johansson, Rupert Penry-Jones, Eddie Marsan, Jonathan Rhys Meyers, Matthew Goode, Emily Mortimer, Brian Cox, Miranda Raison, Colin Salmon, Mark Gatiss

crew: Zack Snyder, Lena Headey, Gerard Butler, Michael Fassbender, Vincent Regan, David Wenham, Stephen McHattie, Dominic West, Rodrigo Santoro, Peter Mensah, John Dunn-Hill
overview: Based on Frank Miller's graphic novel, "300" is very loosely based the 480 B.C. Battle of Thermopylae, where the King of Sparta led his army against the advancing Persians; the battle is said to have inspired all of Greece to band together against the Persians, and helped usher in the world's first democracy.

crew: Espen Sandberg, Joachim Rønning, Salma Hayek Pinault, Steve Zahn, Penélope Cruz, Joseph D. Reitman, Sam Shepard, Gary Carlos Cervantes, Edgar Vivar, Dwight Yoakam, Ernesto Gómez Cruz, Ismael 'East' Carlo
overview: Set in the late 19th century. When a ruthless robber baron takes away everything they cherish, a rough-and-tumble, idealistic peasant and a sophisticated heiress embark on a quest for justice, vengeance…and a few good heists.

crew: Julian Jarrold, Anne Hathaway, James McAvoy, Julie Walters, James Cromwell, Helen McCrory, Maggie Smith, Lucy Cohu, Anna Maxwell Martin, Ian Richardson, Joe Anderson

crew: Kamal Tabrizi, Rana Azadivar, Mehran Rajabi, Bahram Ebrahimi, Emre Tetikel, Parviz Parastouei, Soheila Razavi, Hossein Abedini, Maede Tahmasbi, Shahrokh Foroutanian, Hossein Soleymani
overview: The satirical commentary on clergymen in post-revolutionary Iran. While in prison, petty criminal Reza (Parviz Parastui) comes across a clergyman, sparking a plan for escape. Reza dons his new acquaintance's clerical robes and makes a bid for freedom. He soon learns that being a clergyman brings little respect from the public. Reza travels to the outlying villages, from where he plots to escape the country. However, his plans must be put on hold when the villagers accept him into their community and expect him to perform religious duties. Will Reza's prison break transform him into an unlikely pillar of the community?

crew: Gary David Goldberg, Diane Lane, Dermot Mulroney, Stockard Channing, Elizabeth Perkins, John Cusack, Patrick St. Esprit, Christopher Plummer, Jordana Spiro, Brad William Henke, Patrick Fabian
overview: Sarah Nolan is a newly divorced woman cautiously rediscovering romance with the enthusiastic but often misguided help of her well-meaning family. As she braves a series of hilarious disastrous mismatches and first dates, Sarah begins to trust her own instincts again and learns that, no matter what, it's never a good idea to give up on love.

crew: David R. Ellis, Samuel L. Jackson, Yan-Kay Crystal Lowe, Sunny Mabrey, Elsa Pataky, Bobby Cannavale, Julianna Margulies, David Koechner, Taylor Kitsch, Rachel Blanchard, Kenan Thompson

An on-board assassin releases a crate full of hundreds of deadly venomous snakes in an attempt to eliminate the witness. Flynn and a host of frightened passengers and crew must band together to survive the slithery threat.

crew: D. J. Caruso, Jeremy Piven, Matthew McConaughey, Al Pacino, Jaime King, Rene Russo, Armand Assante, Susan Ward, Kendall Cross, Gary Hudson, Carly Pope
overview: A former college athlete joins forces with a sports consultant to handicap football games for high-rolling gamblers.

crew: Fyodor Bondarchuk, Aleksei Kravchenko, Mikhail Efremov, Fyodor Bondarchuk, Aleksey Serebryakov, Mikhail Evlanov, Mikhail Porechenkov, Amadu Mamadakov, Artur Smolyaninov, Svetlana Ivanova, Aleksandr Lykov
overview: Russian army recruits complete training and take their posting in late 1980s Afghanistan, where the insurgents are slowly gaining the upper hand.

crew: Justin Lin, James Franco, Chi McBride, Tyrese Gibson, Donnie Wahlberg, Jordana Brewster, Jim Parrack, Charles Napier, Vicellous Shannon, Brian Goodman, Wilmer Calderon
overview: Jake Huard, from a shipbuilders family, promised his dying mother he'ld make it to Anapolis Naval Academy. Thanks to tenaciously bugging a Congressman, he's selected despite dubious grades. Once inside, Jake soon proves sub-standard academically. Constantly challenged to his limits, repeatedly made the 'over-cocky' reason for the entire class to suffer, Jake nearly quits, but after facing his utterly un-supportive father's gloating returns just in time. Stubborn Jake finds support withs mates as well as Senor Ali, his lover-to-be, and a discipline he may excel in: the 'brigade' boxing tournament, open to all ranks.

crew: Bent Hamer, Marisa Tomei, Matt Dillon, Lili Taylor, Fisher Stevens, Bruce Bohne, Raye Birk, Didier Flamand, Lana Schwab, Tony Papenfuss, Karen Young
overview: This drama centers on Hank Chinaski, the fictional alter-ego of "Factotum" author Charles Bukowski, who wanders around Los Angeles, CA trying to live off jobs which don't interfere with his primary interest, which is writing. Along the way, he fends off the distractions offered by women, drinking and gambling.

originalTitle: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
crew: David Yates, Emma Watson, Daniel Radcliffe, Helena Bonham Carter, Julie Walters, Alan Rickman, Helen McCrory, Tom Felton, Jason Isaacs, Rupert Grint, Ralph Ineson
overview: As Lord Voldemort tightens his grip on both the Muggle and wizarding worlds, Hogwarts is no longer a safe haven. Harry suspects perils may even lie within the castle, but Dumbledore is more intent upon preparing him for the final battle fast approaching. Together they work to find the key to unlock Voldemorts defenses and to this end, Dumbledore recruits his old friend and colleague Horace Slughorn, whom he believes holds crucial information. Even as the decisive showdown looms, romance blossoms for Harry, Ron, Hermione and their classmates. Love is in the air, but danger lies ahead and Hogwarts may never be the same again.

crew: Damien O'Donnell, James McAvoy, Romola Garai, Brenda Fricker, Steven Robertson, Stanley Townsend, Ruth McCabe, Tom Hickey, Gerard McSorley, Conor Hegarty, Anna Healy
overview: Michael is a 24-year-old who has cerebral palsy and long-term resident of the Carrigmore Residential Home for the Disabled, run by the formidable Eileen. His life is transformed when the maverick Rory O'Shea moves in.

crew: Michael Bay, Megan Fox, Michael Bay, Shia LaBeouf, Josh Duhamel, Tyrese Gibson, Jon Voight, Hugo Weaving, Odette Annable, John Turturro, J.P. Manoux
overview: Young teenager Sam Witwicky becomes involved in the ancient struggle between two extraterrestrial factions of transforming robots – the heroic Autobots and the evil Decepticons. Sam holds the clue to unimaginable power and the Decepticons will stop at nothing to retrieve it.

crew: David Dhawan, Salman Khan, Akshay Kumar, Priyanka Chopra Jonas, Amrish Puri, Rajpal Yadav, Satish Shah, Supriya Karnik, Kader Khan, Mushtaq Khan, Amrita Arora
overview: Sameer, fast at losing his temper is re-located to Goa where he falls in love with Rani. But Sameer's new roommate Sunny, has some plans of his own.

crew: Anders Thomas Jensen, Mads Mikkelsen, Nikolaj Lie Kaas, Lars Ranthe, Ulrich Thomsen, Nicolas Bro, Ole Thestrup, Tomas Villum Jensen, Paprika Steen, Ali Kazim, Gyrd Løfquist
overview: A neo-nazi sentenced to community service at a church clashes with the blindly devotional priest.

crew: Abbas Alibhai Burmawalla, Mustan Alibhai Burmawalla, Kareena Kapoor Khan, Akshay Kumar, Priyanka Chopra Jonas, Amrish Puri, Paresh Rawal, Annu Kapoor, Upasna Singh, Dinesh Lamba
overview: Aitraaz revolves around the character Raj Malhotra (Akshay Kumar) a successful businessman who has everything going for him, including a lovely wife (Kareena Kapoor). Just when he thinks things can't get any better, Sonia (Priyanka Chopra) - his ex-girlfriend, now the boss's wife - walks back into his life - and she wants Raj at any cost.

originalTitle: Dreamer: Inspired by a True Story
crew: John Gatins, Dakota Fanning, Elisabeth Shue, Kurt Russell, David Morse, Freddy Rodríguez, Kris Kristofferson, Oded Fehr, Luis Guzmán, Holmes Osborne, Ken Howard
overview: Ben Crane believes that a severely injured racehorse deserves another chance. He and his daughter Cale adopt the mare and save it from being sacrificed by the owner.

crew: Clint Eastwood, Ryan Phillippe, Robert Patrick, Neal McDonough, Paul Walker, Scott Eastwood, Jason Gray-Stanford, Barry Pepper, Jamie Bell, Silas Weir Mitchell, Melanie Lynskey
overview: There were five Marines and one Navy Corpsman photographed raising the U.S. flag on Mt. Suribachi by Joe Rosenthal on February 23, 1945. This is the story of three of the six surviving servicemen - John 'Doc' Bradley, Pvt. Rene Gagnon and Pvt. Ira Hayes - who fought in the battle to take Iwo Jima from the Japanese.

crew: Sam Mendes, Jake Gyllenhaal, John Krasinski, Peter Sarsgaard, Lucas Black, Laz Alonso, Dennis Haysbert, Brian Geraghty, Jamie Foxx, Chris Cooper, Evan Jones
overview: Jarhead is a film about a US Marine Anthony Swofford’s experience in the Gulf War. After putting up with an arduous boot camp, Swofford and his unit are sent to the Persian Gulf where they are eager to fight, but are forced to stay back from the action. Swofford struggles with the possibility of his girlfriend cheating on him, and as his mental state deteriorates, his desire to kill increases.

crew: Phil Morrison, Amy Adams, Embeth Davidtz, Jill Wagner, Celia Weston, Scott Wilson, Frank Hoyt Taylor, Alessandro Nivola, Ben McKenzie, Matt Besser, Alicia Van Couvering
overview: On the way to meet with an independent artist in the South, newlywed art dealer Madeleine is convinced by her husband, George, that they should stop to meet his family in North Carolina. Madeleine's affluent lifestyle clashes with the family, but she befriends George's wide-eyed and pregnant sister-in-law, Ashley, who is nearing her due date. Through the family, Madeleine gains greater insight into George's character.

crew: George A. Romero, John Leguizamo, Devon Bostick, Simon Pegg, Simon Baker, Asia Argento, Dennis Hopper, George A. Romero, Sasha Roiz, Peter Outerbridge, Robert Joy
overview: The world is full of zombies and the survivors have barricaded themselves inside a walled city to keep out the living dead. As the wealthy hide out in skyscrapers and chaos rules the streets, the rest of the survivors must find a way to stop the evolving zombies from breaking into the city.

crew: Clement Virgo, Lauren Lee Smith, Eric Balfour, Mayko Nguyen, Don Francks, Kristin Lehman, Polly Shannon, Kate Lynch, Frank Chiesurin, Richard Chevolleau, Ron White
overview: Happily unattached, the sexually voracious Leila satisfies her desires with a host of rapidly changing bed partners, unconcerned about the emotional consequences. But that all changes when she meets an artist looking for a deeper commitment.

crew: Neeraj Vora, Akshay Kumar, Tabu, Suniel Shetty, Rajpal Yadav, Bipasha Basu, Johny Lever, Gulshan Grover, Rimi Sen, Sharat Saxena, Dinesh Hingoo
overview: Babu Rao, Raju and Shyam, are living happily after having risen from rags to riches. Still, money brings the joy of riches and with it the greed to make more money - and so, with a don as an unknowing investor, Raju initiates a new game.

crew: Roberto Benigni, Jean Reno, Emilia Fox, Roberto Benigni, Tom Waits, Abdelhafid Metalsi, Nicoletta Braschi, Giuseppe Battiston, Franco Barbero, David Tristan Birkin, Andrea Renzi
overview: Love and injury in time of war. Attilio de Giovanni teaches poetry in Italy. He has a romantic soul, and women love him. But he is in love with Vittoria, and the love is unrequited. Every night he dreams of marrying her, in his boxer shorts and t-shirt, as Tom Waits sings. Vittoria travels to Iraq with her friend, Fuad, a poet; they are there with the second Gulf War breaks out. Vittoria is injured. Attilio must get to her side, and then, as war rages around him, he must find her the medical care she needs. In war, does love conquer all?

originalTitle: The Three Burials of Melquiades Estrada
crew: Tommy Lee Jones, Tommy Lee Jones, Barry Pepper, Melissa Leo, January Jones, Mel Rodriguez, Sonny Carl Davis, Julio Cesar Cedillo, Dwight Yoakam, Vanessa Bauche, Cecilia Suárez
overview: When brash Texas border officer Mike Norton wrongfully kills and buries the friend and ranch hand of Pete Perkins, the latter is reminded of a promise he made to bury his friend, Melquiades Estrada, in his Mexican home town. He kidnaps Norton and exhumes Estrada's corpse, and the odd caravan sets out on horseback for Mexico.

crew: Shane Meadows, Paddy Considine, Toby Kebbell, Seamus O'Neill, Neil Bell, Jo Hartley, Andrew Shim, Gary Stretch, Emily Aston, Stuart Wolfenden, George Newton
overview: A soldier returns to his small town and exacts a deadly revenge on the thugs who tormented his disabled brother while he was away.

crew: Andrzej Bartkowiak, Karl Urban, Rosamund Pike, Dwayne Johnson, Doug Jones, Richard Brake, Barbara Nedeljakova, Ben Daniels, Dexter Fletcher, Deobia Oparei, Brian Steele
overview: A team of space marines known as the Rapid Response Tactical Squad, led by Sarge, is sent to a science facility on Mars after somebody reports a security breach. There, they learn that the alert came after a test subject, a mass murderer purposefully injected with alien DNA, broke free and began killing people. Dr. Grimm, who is related to team member Reaper, informs them all that the chromosome can mutate humans into monsters -- and is highly infectious.

crew: Sidney Lumet, Vin Diesel, Peter Dinklage, Annabella Sciorra, Richard Portnow, Linus Roache, Domenick Lombardozzi, Josh Pais, Marcia Jean Kurtz, Raúl Esparza, Ron Silver
overview: Based on the true story of Jack DiNorscio, a mobster who defended himself in court for what would be the longest mafia trial in U.S. history.

crew: Jonathan Kasdan, Kristen Stewart, Meg Ryan, Makenzie Vega, Ginnifer Goodwin, JoBeth Williams, Dustin Milligan, Adam Brody, Clark Gregg, Danielle Savre, Elena Anaya
overview: After a bad breakup with his girlfriend leaves him heartbroken, Carter Webb moves to Michigan to take care of his ailing grandmother. Once there, he gets mixed up in the lives of the mother and daughters who live across the street.

crew: Marc Forster, Saïd Taghmaoui, Shaun Toub, Homayoun Ershadi, Khalid Abdalla, Elham Ehsas, Mustafa Haidari, Zekeria Ebrahimi, Atossa Leoni, Kenny Santiago Marrero, Ahmad Khan Mahmoodzada
overview: After spending years in California, Amir returns to his homeland in Afghanistan to help his old friend Hassan, whose son is in trouble.

crew: Robert Altman, Tommy Lee Jones, Lindsay Lohan, Maya Rudolph, Woody Harrelson, L.Q. Jones, Kevin Kline, Meryl Streep, Virginia Madsen, John C. Reilly, Lily Tomlin
overview: A look at what goes on backstage during the last broadcast of America's most celebrated radio show, where singing cowboys Dusty and Lefty, a country music siren, and a host of others hold court.

crew: Marco Kreuzpaintner, Ludwig Blochberger, Alicja Bachleda-Curuś, Jeff Fischer, Kostja Ullmann, Hanno Koffler, Robert Stadlober, Jürgen Tonkel, Alexa Maria Surholt, Miriam Morgenstern, Joseph M'Barek
overview: Tobi and Achim, the pride of the local crew club, have been the best of friends for years and are convinced that nothing will ever stand in the way of their friendship. They look forward to the upcoming summer camp and the crew competition. Then the gay team from Berlin arrives and Tobi is totally confused. The evening before the races begin, the storm that breaks out is more than meteor-logical.

crew: Marc Forster, Emma Thompson, Will Ferrell, Maggie Gyllenhaal, Queen Latifah, Dustin Hoffman, Linda Hunt, Tony Hale, Tom Hulce, Kristin Chenoweth, Christian Stolte
overview: Harold Crick is a lonely IRS agent whose mundane existence is transformed when he hears a mysterious voice narrating his life.

crew: Robert Stevenhagen, Sam Fell, Emma Watson, Sigourney Weaver, Christopher Lloyd, William H. Macy, Stanley Tucci, Kevin Kline, Richard Jenkins, Ciarán Hinds, Matthew Broderick, Dustin Hoffman
overview: Once upon a time... in the far away kingdom of Dor... lived a brave and virtuous mouse with comically oversized ears who dreamt of becoming a knight. Banished from his home for having such lofty ambitions, Despereaux sets off on an amazing adventure with his good-hearted rat friend Roscuro, who leads him, at long last, on a very noble quest to rescue an endangered princess and save an entire kingdom from darkness.

crew: Fruit Chan, Park Chan-wook, Takashi Miike, Tony Leung Ka-fai, Lee Byung-hun, Bai Ling, Miriam Yeung Chin-Wah, Kang Hye-jung, Lee Dae-yeon, Yum Jung-ah, Im Won-hee, Kyoko Hasegawa, Atsuro Watabe
overview: An Asian cross-cultural trilogy of horror films from accomplished indie directors: "Dumplings", directed by Fruit Chan of Hong Kong; "Cut", directed by Park Chan-Wook of Korea; "Box", directed by Miike Takashi of Japan. The first film "Dumplings" was extended and turned into a full-length theatrical film of the same name.

crew: Kyle Patrick Alvarez, Billy Crudup, Ezra Miller, Moisés Arias, Ki Hong Lee, Michael Angarano, Nicholas Braun, Olivia Thirlby, Johnny Simmons, Tye Sheridan, Callan McAuliffe
overview: This film is based on the actual events that took place in 1971 when Stanford professor Dr. Philip Zimbardo created what became one of the most shocking and famous social experiments of all time.

originalTitle: The Texas Chainsaw Massacre: The Beginning
crew: Jonathan Liebesman, Matt Bomer, R. Lee Ermey, Jordana Brewster, John Larroquette, Diora Baird, Lee Tergesen, Lew Temple, Andrew Bryniarski, Taylor Handley, Cyia Batten
overview: Chrissie and her friends set out on a road trip for a final fling before one is shipped off to Vietnam. Along the way, bikers harass the foursome and cause an accident that throws Chrissie from the vehicle. The lawman who arrives on the scene kills one of the bikers and brings Chrissie's friends to the Hewitt homestead, where young Leatherface is learning the tools of terror.

crew: Yash Chopra, Shah Rukh Khan, Preity Zinta, Rani Mukerji, Amitabh Bachchan, Anupam Kher, Hema Malini, Boman Irani, Kirron Kher, Manoj Bajpayee, Divya Dutta

crew: Fabián Bielinsky, Nahuel Pérez Biscayart, Ricardo Darín, Dolores Fonzi, Alejandro Awada, Jorge D'Elía, Rafa Castejón, Claudio Rissi, Pablo Cedrón, Walter Reyno, Tatiana Saphir
overview: A quiet, epileptic taxidermist plans the perfect crime. All he needs is the right opportunity. An accident, perhaps…

crew: Douglas McGrath, Hope Davis, Daniel Craig, Sigourney Weaver, Sandra Bullock, Toby Jones, Gwyneth Paltrow, Lee Pace, Jeff Daniels, John Benjamin Hickey, Isabella Rossellini
overview: While researching his book In Cold Blood, writer Truman Capote develops a close relationship with convicted murderers Dick Hickock and Perry Smith.

crew: Michael Caton-Jones, Hugh Dancy, John Hurt, Nicola Walker, Steve Toussaint, David Gyasi, Clare-Hope Ashitey, Dominique Horwitz, Victor Power, Susan Nalwoga, Victor Power
overview: Two westerners, a priest and a teacher find themselves in the middle of the Rwandan genocide and face a moral dilemna. Do they place themselves in danger and protect the refugees, or escape the country with their lives? Based on a true story.

crew: Tony Scott, Keira Knightley, Mena Suvari, Lucy Liu, Christopher Walken, Jacqueline Bisset, Stanley Kamel, Mickey Rourke, Donna W. Scott, Liza Lapira, Dale Dickey
overview: The story of the life of Domino Harvey, who abandoned her career as a Ford model to become a bounty hunter.

crew: David Ayer, Keanu Reeves, Chris Evans, Hugh Laurie, Forest Whitaker, Cedric the Entertainer, John Corbett, Martha Higareda, Common, Noel Gugliemi, Terry Crews

When evidence implicates him in the execution of a fellow officer, he is forced to go up against the cop culture he's been a part of his entire career, ultimately leading him to question the loyalties of everyone around him.

crew: Anton Corbijn, Alexandra Maria Lara, Samantha Morton, Joe Anderson, Toby Kebbell, Matthew McNulty, Sam Riley, Craig Parkinson, Harry Treadaway, Herbert Grönemeyer, Tim Plester
overview: The story of Joy Division’s lead singer Ian Curtis, from his schoolboy days in 1973 to his suicide on the eve of the band's first American tour in 1980.

crew: John Hillcoat, Ray Winstone, Danny Huston, Guy Pearce, John Hurt, David Wenham, Emily Watson, David Gulpilil, Noah Taylor, Robert Morgan, Bogdan Koca
overview: In 1880s Australia, a lawman offers renegade Charlie Burns a difficult choice. In order to save his younger brother from the gallows, Charlie must hunt down and kill his older brother, who is wanted for rape and murder. Venturing into one of the Outback's most inhospitable regions, Charlie faces a terrible moral dilemma that can end only in violence.

originalTitle: The Curious Case of Benjamin Button
crew: David Fincher, Brad Pitt, Elle Fanning, Tilda Swinton, Cate Blanchett, Taraji P. Henson, Elias Koteas, Mahershala Ali, Julia Ormond, Jason Flemyng, Josh Stewart
overview: Born under unusual circumstances, Benjamin Button springs into being as an elderly man in a New Orleans nursing home and ages in reverse. Twelve years after his birth, he meets Daisy, a child who flits in and out of his life as she grows up to be a dancer. Though he has all sorts of unusual adventures over the course of his life, it is his relationship with Daisy, and the hope that they will come together at the right time, that drives Benjamin forward.

crew: Ol Parker, Piper Perabo, Lena Headey, Matthew Goode, Ben Miles, Anthony Stewart Head, Ben Willbond, Darren Boyd, Celia Imrie, Eva Birthistle, Gerard Horan
overview: During her wedding ceremony, Rachel notices Luce in the audience and feels instantly drawn to her. The two women become close friends, and when Rachel learns that Luce is a lesbian, she realizes that despite her happy marriage to Heck, she is falling for Luce. As she questions her sexual orientation, Rachel must decide between her stable relationship with Heck and her exhilarating new romance with Luce.

crew: Sanjay Gadhvi, John Abraham, Esha Deol, Rimi Sen, Abhishek Bachchan, Manoj Joshi, Ayesha Raza Mishra, Uday Chopra, Arav Chowdhary, Perizaad Zorabian, Farid Amiri
overview: A gang of bikers headed by the cool-headed and arrogant Kabir is on a robbing spree in Mumbai. They rob establishments and then zip away on their superbikes. ACP Jai Dixit is the case in-charge and he recruits a bumbling bike mechanic and racer named Ali to chase the gang on a bike and help Jai nab them. Kabir accepts the challenge, and pulls off another robbery amidst a function. This causes Jai and Ali to call it off. Jai resigns from the police force and Ali goes back to his daily job. Meanwhile Kabir has lost one of his team members and recruits Ali for their final job in Goa. The action shifts from the congested Mumbai traffic to the sunny Goa for the final showdown between cops and robbers.

originalTitle: Diary of a Mad Black Woman
crew: Darren Grant, Tamara Taylor, Shemar Moore, Steve Harris, Tyler Perry, Kimberly Elise, L. Warren Young, Christian Keyes, Wilbur Fitzgerald, E. Roger Mitchell, Chandra Currelley-Young
overview: Charles, an attorney, and Helen, his devoted wife, seemed to have everything – money, a beautiful mansion – the American Dream. However, as Helen prepares to celebrate their 18th wedding anniversary, her life takes an unexpected twist when she comes home to find her clothes packed up in a U-Haul van parked in the driveway. Charles is divorcing her and kicks her out. Helen moves in with her grandmother Madea, an old woman who doesn't take any lip from anyone. Madea helps Helen through these tough times by showing her what is really important in life. Helen is forced to rediscover love, life and religion on her pursuit for happiness.

crew: Jaume Balagueró, Gemma Jones, Calista Flockhart, Elena Anaya, Ivana Baquero, Richard Roxburgh, Colin McFarlane, Michael Pennington, Daniel Ortiz, Yasmin Murphy
overview: Haunted by memories of a patient's death, a nurse  takes a job at an antiquated hospital for children. Soon she learns that the kids fear a ghost that prowls the floors and will not allow anyone to leave. Amy tries to protect them and convince the other staffers of the evil that lurks there.

originalTitle: Fur: An Imaginary Portrait of Diane Arbus
crew: Steven Shainberg, Robert Downey Jr., Nicole Kidman, Emmy Clarke, Harris Yulin, Ty Burrell, Marceline Hugot, Matt Servitto, Emily Bergl, Boris McGiver, Jane Alexander
overview: In 1958 New York Diane Arbus is a housewife and mother who works as an assistant to her husband, a photographer employed by her wealthy parents. Respectable though her life is, she cannot help but feel uncomfortable in her privileged world. One night, a new neighbor catches Diane's eye, and the enigmatic man inspires her to set forth on the path to discovering her own artistry.

crew: Dharani, Vijay, Brahmanandam, Prakash Raj, Trisha Krishnan, T. K. Kala, Ashish Vidhyarthi, Tanikella Bharani, Ponnambalam, Vimal, Janaki Sabesh
overview: Muthu Pandi, a village strongman, decides to marry Dhanalakshmi, and begins his quest by eliminating everyone who opposes their union - starting with both her brothers. In desperation, Dhanalakshmi decides to escape from the village, and in the process is unwittingly assisted by a university Kabaddi player Velu.

crew: Adam Green, Robert Englund, Tony Todd, Joel David Moore, Amara Zaragoza, Deon Richmond, Richard Riehle, Kane Hodder, Joshua Leonard, Joel Murray, Parry Shen
overview: When a group of tourists on a New Orleans haunted swamp tour find themselves stranded in the wilderness, their evening of fun and spooks turns into a horrific nightmare.

crew: Sofia Coppola, Tom Hardy, Kirsten Dunst, Shirley Henderson, Rose Byrne, Danny Huston, Asia Argento, Jamie Dornan, Jason Schwartzman, Steve Coogan, Judy Davis
overview: The retelling of France’s iconic but ill-fated queen, Marie Antoinette. From her betrothal and marriage to Louis XVI at 15 to her reign as queen at 19 and ultimately the fall of Versailles.

crew: Laurie Collyer, Giancarlo Esposito, Maggie Gyllenhaal, Danny Trejo, Brad William Henke, Ryan Simpkins, Sam Bottoms, Kate Burton, Michelle Hurst, Rio Hackford, Bridget Barkan
overview: After serving time in prison, former drug addict Sherry Swanson returns home to reclaim her young daughter from family members who have been raising the child. Sherry's family, especially her sister-in-law, doubt Sherry's ability to be a good mother, and Sherry finds her resolve to stay clean slowly weakening.

crew: Michael Winterbottom, Shirley Henderson, Gillian Anderson, Benedict Wong, Kelly Macdonald, Kieran O'Brien, Steve Coogan, Jeremy Northam, Naomie Harris, Keeley Hawes, James Fleet
overview: Steve Coogan, an arrogant actor with low self-esteem and a complicated love life, is playing the eponymous role in an adaptation of "The Life and Opinions of Tristram Shandy, Gentleman" being filmed at a stately home. He constantly spars with actor Rob Brydon, who is playing Uncle Toby and believes his role to be of equal importance to Coogan's.

crew: Jon Poll, Robert Downey Jr., Hope Davis, Sarah Gadon, Mark Rendall, Kat Dennings, Megan Park, Anton Yelchin, Jake Epstein, Lauren Collins, Noam Jenkins

Charlie needs some friends fast, and decides that the best way to find them is to appoint himself the resident psychiatrist. He becomes one of the most popular guys in school by doling out advice and, occasionally, medication, to the student body.

crew: David Slade, Patrick Wilson, Elliot Page, Sandra Oh, Odessa Rae, G.J. Echternkamp, Cori Bright
overview: Hayley’s a smart, charming teenage girl. Jeff’s a handsome, smooth fashion photographer. An Internet chat, a coffee shop meet-up, an impromptu fashion shoot back at Jeff’s place. Jeff thinks it’s his lucky night. He’s in for a surprise.

crew: Christian Carion, Daniel Brühl, Diane Kruger, Alex Ferns, Ian Richardson, Gary Lewis, Guillaume Canet, Christopher Fulford, Dany Boon, Steven Robertson, Benno Fürmann
overview: France, 1914, during World War I. On Christmas Eve, an extraordinary event takes place in the bloody no man's land that the French and the Scots dispute with the Germans…

overview: Turtles Can Fly tells the story of a group of young children near the Turkey-Iran border. They clean up mines and wait for the Saddam regime to fall.

crew: Kevin Smith, Ben Affleck, Jason Lee, Rosario Dawson, Kevin Michael Richardson, Harley Quinn Smith, Ethan Suplee, Brian O'Halloran, Wanda Sykes, Trevor Fehrman, Tracy Phillips
overview: A calamity at Dante and Randall's shops sends them looking for new horizons - but they ultimately settle at Mooby's, a fictional Disney-McDonald's-style fast-food empire.

crew: Robert Ben Garant, Robert Patrick, Christopher Walken, Diedrich Bader, James Hong, Aisha Tyler, Jason Scott Lee, Thomas Lennon, Maggie Q, George Lopez, David Koechner
overview: Randy Daytona was a child ping pong prodigy who lost his chance at Olympic gold when his father is murdered by the mysterious Feng over a gambling debt. 15yrs later he's down on his luck and scraping a living doing seedy back room shows in Vegas; when the FBI turn up and ask for his help to take down Feng... who just happens to love Ping Pong.

crew: Neil Armfield, Heath Ledger, Geoffrey Rush, Abbie Cornish, Damon Herriman, Tara Morice, Noni Hazlehurst, Luke Davies, Jason Chan, Alicia Hannah, Adrienne Pickering
overview: A poet falls in love with an art student, who gravitates to his bohemian lifestyle — and his love of heroin. Hooked as much on one another as they are on the drug, their relationship alternates between states of oblivion, self-destruction, and despair.

crew: Agnieszka Holland, Diane Kruger, Matthew Goode, Ed Harris, Phyllida Law, Joe Anderson, Karl Johnson, Angus Barnett, Ralph Riach, Matyelok Gibbs, Bill Stewart
overview: A fictionalised exploration of Beethoven's life in his final days working on his Ninth Symphony. It is 1824. Beethoven is racing to finish his new symphony. However, it has been years since his last success and he is plagued by deafness, loneliness and personal trauma. A copyist is urgently needed to help the composer. A fictional character is introduced in the form of a young conservatory student and aspiring composer named Anna Holtz. The mercurial Beethoven is skeptical that a woman might become involved in his masterpiece but slowly comes to trust in Anna's assistance and in the end becomes quite fond of her. By the time the piece is performed, her presence in his life is an absolute necessity. Her deep understanding of his work is such that she even corrects mistakes he has made, while her passionate personality opens a door into his private world.

crew: Greg Coolidge, Sean Whalen, Dane Cook, Andy Dick, Danny Woodburn, Dax Shepard, Brian George, Efren Ramirez, Harland Williams, Tim Bagley, Victor Izay
overview: When he hears that the new female employee digs ambitious men who are the store employee of the month, a slacker gets his act together but finds himself in competition with his rival, an ambitious co-worker.

crew: Peter Segal, Anne Hathaway, Steve Carell, Dwayne Johnson, James Caan, Alan Arkin, Bill Murray, Terence Stamp, Patrick Warburton, Mo Gallini, Bernie Kopell
overview: When members of the nefarious crime syndicate KAOS attack the U.S. spy agency Control and the identities of secret agents are compromised, the Chief has to promote hapless but eager analyst Maxwell Smart to field agent. He is partnered with veteran and capable Agent 99, the only spy whose cover remains intact. Can they work together to thwart the evil world-domination plans of KAOS and its crafty operative?

crew: Yavuz Turgul, Mine Tugay, Meltem Cumbul, Güven Kıraç, Berat Yenilmez, Timuçin Esen, Engin Yüksel, Şener Şen, Erdal Tosun, Sümer Tilmaç, Engin Alpateş
overview: A retired teacher who returns to Istanbul after years away, Nazim tries to reacquaint himself with his hometown, which has changed significantly. While waiting for his pension to begin, Nazim takes a temporary job as a taxi driver and frequently ends up in the seedier parts of the city. …

crew: Edgar Wright, Bill Nighy, Martin Freeman, Cate Blanchett, Simon Pegg, Jim Broadbent, Timothy Dalton, Rory McCann, Lucy Punch, Paddy Considine, Peter Jackson
overview: Former London constable Nicholas Angel finds it difficult to adapt to his new assignment in the sleepy British village of Sandford. Not only does he miss the excitement of the big city, but he also has a well-meaning oaf for a partner. However, when a series of grisly accidents rocks Sandford, Angel smells something rotten in the idyllic village.

crew: Mark Waters, Reese Witherspoon, Rosalind Chao, Donal Logue, Ivana Miličević, Jon Heder, Willie Garson, Mark Ruffalo, Joel McKinnon Miller, Dina Spybey-Waters, Tony Brubaker
overview: Shortly after David Abbott moves into his new San Francisco digs, he has an unwelcome visitor on his hands: winsome Elizabeth Martinson, who asserts that the apartment is hers -- and promptly vanishes. When she starts appearing and disappearing at will, David thinks she's a ghost, while Elizabeth is convinced she's alive.

crew: Paul McGuigan, Morgan Freeman, Lucy Liu, Bruce Willis, Mykelti Williamson, Stanley Tucci, Josh Hartnett, Ben Kingsley, Danny Aiello, Robert Forster, Peter Outerbridge
overview: Slevin is mistakenly put in the middle of a personal war between the city’s biggest criminal bosses. Under constant watch, Slevin must try not to get killed by an infamous assassin and come up with an idea of how to get out of his current dilemma.

overview: After his entire department is outsourced, an American novelty products salesman heads to India to train his replacement.

crew: Mert Baykal, Erol Günaydın, Sermiyan Midyat, Ferhan Şensoy, Rasim Öztekin, Şahnaz Çakıralp, Hakan Bilgin, Mert Baykal, Ali Çatalbaş, Erkan Üçüncü, Fatih Ürek
overview: Based on a true event, Pardon tells the tragicomic story of three friends who end up in prison when they are mistaken as members of a terrorist organization. Ibrahim's fear of uniforms makes him runaway whenever he sees one. Because of this, police mistakes him with a terrorist and takes him and his friend Muzo into custody. Fooled by the police during the interrogation they name another friend, Aydin, in hope of saving themselves. As they all end up in prison, they remember the families and lovers they left behind.

crew: Nicolas Winding Refn, Zlatko Burić, Ramadan Huseini, Linse Kessler, Slavko Labović, Marinela Dekic, Levino Jensen, Kurt Nielsen, Ilyas Agac, Slavica Knežević, Marek Magierecki
overview: Milo is aging, he is planning his daughter's 25th birthday, and his shipment of heroin turns out to be 10,000 pills of ecstasy. When Milo tries to sell the pills anyway, all Hell breaks loose and his only chance is to ask for help from his ex-henchman and old friend Radovan.

crew: David Schwimmer, Thandiwe Newton, Simon Pegg, Hank Azaria, Iddo Goldberg, India de Beaufort, Peter Serafinowicz, Stephen Merchant, David Walliams, Ruth Sheen, Harish Patel
overview: Five years after jilting his pregnant fiancée on their wedding day, out-of-shape Dennis decides to run a marathon to win her back.

crew: Danny Pang, Oxide Chun Pang, Kristen Stewart, Jodelle Ferland, Tatiana Maslany, Penelope Ann Miller, John Corbett, Dustin Milligan, Dylan McDermott, William B. Davis, Michael Daingerfield, Brent Briscoe

Soon after arriving, teenage Jess (Kristen Stewart) and her younger brother see terrifying apparitions and endure attacks from a supernatural source. Jess must warn her disbelieving family before it is too late to save them.

crew: Mike Clattenburg, Hugh Dillon, Nichole Hiltz, Mike Smith, John Dunsworth, Sarah Dunsworth, John Paul Tremblay, Barrie Dunn, Robb Wells, Alex Lifeson, Lydia Lawson-Baird
overview: The boys get arrested for robbing an ATM machine and spend 18 months in jail. When the get out, they decide to pull off "The Big Dirty" which is to steal a large amount of coins because they are untraceable and quit their life of crime forever

overview: In 208 A.D., in the final days of the Han Dynasty, shrewd Prime Minster Cao convinced the fickle Emperor Han the only way to unite all of China was to declare war on the kingdoms of Xu in the west and East Wu in the south. Thus began a military campaign of unprecedented scale. Left with no other hope for survival, the kingdoms of Xu and East Wu formed an unlikely alliance.

crew: John Gulager, Eric Dane, Krista Allen, Clu Gulager, Judah Friedlander, Balthazar Getty, Henry Rollins, Jason Mewes, Josh Zuckerman, Navi Rawat, Jenny Wade
overview: When a motley crew of strangers find themselves trapped in an isolated tavern, they must band together in a battle for survival against a family of flesh-hungry creatures.

crew: Marc Rothemund, Julia Jentsch, André Hennicke, Alexander Held, Johanna Gastdorf, Fabian Hinrichs, Maximilian Brückner, Petra Kelling, Florian Stetter, Jörg Hube, Christian Hoening
overview: In 1943, as Hitler continues to wage war across Europe, a group of college students mount an underground resistance movement in Munich. Dedicated expressly to the downfall of the monolithic Third Reich war machine, they call themselves the White Rose. One of its few female members, Sophie Scholl is captured during a dangerous mission to distribute pamphlets on campus with her brother Hans. Unwavering in her convictions and loyalty to the White Rose, her cross-examination by the Gestapo quickly escalates into a searing test of wills as Scholl delivers a passionate call to freedom and personal responsibility.

crew: Nick Cassavetes, Amanda Seyfried, Amber Heard, Emile Hirsch, Bruce Willis, Olivia Wilde, Sharon Stone, Devin Kamin, Harry Dean Stanton, Alex Kingston, Lukas Haas
overview: Johnny Truelove likes to see himself as tough. He's the son of an underworld figure and a drug dealer. Johnny also likes to get tough when things don't go his way. When Jake Mazursky fails to pay up for Johnny, things get worse for the Mazursky family, as Johnny and his 'gang' kidnap Jake's 15 year old brother and holds him hostage. Problem now is what to do with 'stolen boy?'

crew: Kirsten Sheridan, Freddie Highmore, Terrence Howard, Mykelti Williamson, Jonathan Rhys Meyers, Robin Williams, Keri Russell, William Sadler, Alex O'Loughlin, Becki Newton, Marian Seldes
overview: Lyla and Louis, a singer and a musician, fall in love, but are soon compelled to separate. Lyla is forced to give up her newborn but unknown to her, he grows up to become a musical genius.

crew: Jay Roach, Steve Carell, Zach Galifianakis, Paul Rudd, Lucy Punch, Bruce Greenwood, Kristen Schaal, Jemaine Clement, Ron Livingston, Octavia Spencer, Nick Kroll

Tim plans on not attending until he meets Barry, a man who builds dioramas using stuffed mice. Barry's blundering but good intentions send Tim's life into a downward spiral, threatening a major business deal and possibly scuttling Tim's engagement to his fiancee.

crew: Tom Dey, Katheryn Winnick, Matthew McConaughey, Kathy Bates, Sarah Jessica Parker, Bradley Cooper, Zooey Deschanel, Rob Corddry, Stephen Tobolowsky, Patton Oswalt, Peter Jacobson
overview: Tripp, an attractive man in his thirties, is still living with his parents Al and Sue. Tripp's best friends Demo and Ace are also still living in their parents' homes and seem proud of it. Al and Sue are not happy, however, and are fascinated when friends whose adult son has recently moved away from home reveal they hired an expert to arrange the matter and couldn't be happier with the result.

crew: Denzel Washington, Glen Powell, Denzel Washington, Forest Whitaker, John Heard, Jurnee Smollett, Kimberly Elise, J.D. Evermore, Nate Parker, Denzel Whitaker, Gina Ravera

They discover an alien virus aboard a crashed space shuttle that transforms anyone who comes into contact with it into unfeeling drones while they sleep. Carol realizes her son holds the key to stopping the spread of the plague and she races to find him before it is too late.

crew: Scott Frank, Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Carla Gugino, Bruce McGill, Isla Fisher, Jeff Daniels, Matthew Goode, Laura Vandervoort, Martin Roach, Janaya Stephens, Alex Borstein

When he incurs the wrath of a senator bent on snuffing out cigarettes, Nick's powers of "filtering the truth" will be put to the test.

crew: Prachya Pinkaew, Tony Jaa, Bongkoj Khongmalai, Nathan Jones, Petchtai Wongkamlao, Jonathan Patrick Foo, Lateef Crowder, Jin Xing, Johnny Nguyen, Ron Smoorenburg, Patrarin Punyanutatam

overview: When Hollywood superstar George Reeves dies in his home, private detective Louis Simo is hired to investigate his death and gets caught in a web of lies involving a big studio executive's wife.

crew: Finn Taylor, Robin Tunney, Winona Ryder, Chris Penn, Juliette Lewis, Lukas Haas, Tim Blake Nelson, Julianna Margulies, Joseph Fiennes, David Arquette, D.B. Sweeney
overview: After botching the capture of a notorious serial killer, idiosyncratic detective Michael Burrows loses his job with the San Francisco Police. He becomes an investigator for an insurance company and joins forces with a cynical field agent to probe suspicious and unusual deaths.

crew: John H. Lee, Son Ye-jin, Jung Woo-sung, David Lee McInnis, Kim Bu-seon, Oh Kwang-rok, Shin Hyun-tak, Kim Joong-ki, Hyun Young, Baek Jong-hak, Shin Cheol-jin
overview: A young couple's love is tested when Sun-jin is diagnosed with a rare form of Alzheimer's disease.

crew: Joe Carnahan, Liam Neeson, Jessica Biel, Patrick Wilson, Bradley Cooper, Jon Hamm, Dwight Schultz, Omari Hardwick, Sharlto Copley, Dirk Benedict, Tom Butler
overview: A man who loves when a plan comes together, Col. Hannibal Smith leads a close-knit team of elite operatives and Iraq War veterans. Framed for a crime they didn't commit, Smith and his men, Capt. H.M. ‘Howling Mad’ Murdock , Sgt. Bosco ‘B.A.’ Baracus, and Lt. Templeton ‘Faceman’ Peck, break out and go rogue, using their special talents to clear their names and find the perpetrator. Hot on their trail is Capt. Charissa Sosa, who was once involved with a member of Smith's team and has sworn to capture them, no matter what it takes.

crew: Elizabeth Allen Rosenbaum, Emma Roberts, Arielle Kebbel, Dichen Lachman, Jake McDorman, Claudia Karvan, Sara Paxton, JoJo, Elizabeth Daily, Tammin Sursok, Bruce Spence
overview: Two teenage girls discover that mermaids really do exist after a violent storm washes one ashore. The mermaid, a sassy creature named Aquamarine, is determined to prove to her father that real love exists, and enlists the girls' help in winning the heart of a handsome lifeguard.

crew: Nick Love, Roland Manookian, Geoff Bell, Georgina Chapman, Danny Dyer, Linda Henry, Martin Marquez, Camille Coduri, Tamer Hassan, Andy Linden, Arturo Venegas
overview: During the '80s, a young man named Frankie dreams of escaping London's South East region, and his mother's thug of a boyfriend gives him just the opportunity.
